calanus: <entryFree id="n6150" type="main" key="Ca^la^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Călănus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Callă-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/lanos</foreign>, <sense id="n6150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Indian philosopher</hi> (<hi rend="ital">gymnosophist</hi>) <hi rend="ital">in the time of Alexander the Great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in old age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burned himself on a funeral pile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 23, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 30, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8</bibl>, ext. 10.</sense></entryFree>
calaris: <entryFree id="n6151" type="main" key="Ca^la^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Călăris</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Călărītānus</orth>, v. Caralis.</entryFree>
calasis: <entryFree id="n6152" type="gloss" key="calasis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calasis</orth>, <sense id="n6152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of tunic which the Greeks call</hi> <foreign lang="greek">kala/sinon</foreign>: alii dicunt nodum esse tunicae muliebris, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=51" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 51</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
calates: <entryFree id="n6153" type="main" key="Ca^la^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Călătes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Grecian painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calathiana: <entryFree id="n6154" type="main" key="ca^la^thi^a_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călăthĭāna vĭŏla</orth>, v. calatina.</entryFree>
calathiscus: <entryFree id="n6155" type="greek" key="ca^la^thiscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călăthiscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kalaqi/skos</foreign>, <sense id="n6155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small wicker basket</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgati calathisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 319</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 41, 6</bibl> Burm.</sense></entryFree>
calathus: <entryFree id="n6156" type="greek" key="ca^la^thus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călăthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/laqos</foreign>. <sense id="n6156.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a wicker basket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hand-basket</hi> (pure Lat. quasillum, made in the shape of a lily); acc. to diff. uses, <hi rend="ital">a flower-basket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wool-basket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a thread-basket</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a fruit-basket</hi>, etc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:435" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 435</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calathi Minervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 805</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 219</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:54" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 264</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 475</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6156.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, any other vessel of similar form, of metal or wood. </sense><sense id="n6156.2" n="A" level="2"> For milke, etc., <hi rend="ital">a milk-pail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bowl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 402</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:397" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 397</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 8, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6156.3" n="B" level="2"> For wine, <hi rend="ital">a wine-cup</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 71</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:60:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 60, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:14:107" default="NO">9, 14, 107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6156.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the cup</hi> or <hi rend="ital">calix of a flower</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:99" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 99</bibl> Schneid.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:240" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 240</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 14, 31</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calatia: <entryFree id="n6157" type="main" key="Ca_la_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cālātĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cālātĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kalati/a</foreign>, <sense id="n6157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Via Appia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Capua and Beneventum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Galazze</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 14, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:542" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 542</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:14" default="NO">11, 14</bibl> sq.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6157.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cālātīni</orth>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:61:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 61, 11 al.</bibl>—In <number>sing.</number> Calatinus, <hi rend="ital">cognomen of M. Atilius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:24:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 24, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 17, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calatina: <entryFree id="n6158" type="main" key="ca^la^ti^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călătĭna vĭŏla</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of gentian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 14, § 27</bibl> dub. (al. calathiana, calatiana).</sense></entryFree>
calatio: <entryFree id="n6159" type="hapax" key="ca^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>calo</etym>, <sense id="n6159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summoning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl>, § 27 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
calator: <entryFree id="n6160" type="main" key="ca^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.; a servant for calling, etc., a crier; hence</etym>, <sense id="n6160.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a servant</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">of priests</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 268</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2431</bibl> sqq.; so freq. in inscriptions.—</sense><sense id="n6160.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">any servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attendant;</hi> cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=38" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 38</bibl> and 225 Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">egomet mihi comes, calator, equus, agaso, armiger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calatorius: <entryFree id="n6161" type="gloss" key="ca^la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>calator</etym>, <sense id="n6161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to priests</hi>' <hi rend="ital">servants</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 449</bibl>, n. 58.</sense></entryFree>
calatus: <entryFree id="n6162" type="main" key="ca^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. calo.</entryFree>
calauria: <entryFree id="n6163" type="main" key="Ca^lauri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Călaurĭa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Călaurēa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 384</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kalau/reia</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">'i/a</foreign>, <sense id="n6163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island on the eastern coast of Argolis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Poro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 56</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Consecrated to Latona</hi>, hence, Calaurea Latois, Ov. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
calautica: <entryFree id="n6164" type="greek" key="ca^lauti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călautĭca</orth> (in many MSS. and edd. erroneously <orth extent="full" lang="la">călantĭca</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>of uncer.tain etym.; acc. to Beier, Cic. Clod. et Cur. 5, p. 107, perh. kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">kalu/ptw</foreign>, as auris, through the Cretan form <foreign lang="greek">au)=s</foreign>, with <foreign lang="greek">ou)=s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n6164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering for the head of women</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which fell down over the shoulders</hi> (perh. a kind of veil): <cit><quote lang="la">calautica est tegmen muliebre, quod capiti innectitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 537, 2 sq.</bibl></cit>: mitrae, semimitrae, calautica, etc.; cf. Mai and Orell. in h. l. (Orell. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> V. 2, p. 336</bibl>); Cic. Fragm. Clod. et Cur. 5, 3 B. and K.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:25:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 25, § 10</bibl>; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 59</bibl>, and Gloss. Philox.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Per. Odyss. 5</bibl>: <foreign lang="greek">ei)=dos zw/nhs</foreign> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 616</bibl>, erron. considers it as of like signif. with mitra).</sense></entryFree>
calbeos: <entryFree id="n6165" type="gloss" key="calbeo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calbeŏs</orth>, v galbeum</entryFree>
calcaneum: <entryFree id="n6166" type="main" key="calca_ne^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcānĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">calcānĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 48</bibl>) [calx] (a rare form for calx), <sense id="n6166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the heel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">camelorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
calcar: <entryFree id="n6167" type="main" key="calcar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for carcar; cf. Sanscr. kar, wound; and Lat. calx</etym>. <sense id="n6167.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a spur</hi> as worn on <hi rend="ital">the heel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcaria dicta, quia in calce hominis ligantur, ad stimulandos equos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 16, 6</bibl></cit> (class. in <cb n="CALC" /> prose and poetry; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. trop.): calcari quadrupedem agitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 118</bibl></cit>: incendere equum calcaribus, <hi rend="ital">to spur one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:48" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 48</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">concitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subdere equo calcaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:4" default="NO">7, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcaribus subditis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 33, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi fodere calcaribus armos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:881" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 881</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcaribus auferre equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:280" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 280</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6167.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">spur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incitement</hi>: calcaribus ictus amoris, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1074" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1074</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicebat Isocrates se calcaribus in Ephoro, contra autem in Theopompo frenis uti solere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter frenis eget, alter calcaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:56:204" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 56, 204</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:74" default="NO">10, 1, 74</bibl>: anticipate atque addite calcar, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 70, 13</bibl>; * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 217</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensum gloria calcar habet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P 4, 2, 36</bibl></cit>.—So also of the driving winds: ventus calcar admovere, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 451, 29</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">addere calcaria sponte currenti,</quote> <trans><tr>to spur a willing horse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6167.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the spur on the leg of the cock</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calcariarius: <entryFree id="n6168" type="gloss" key="calca_ri^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcārĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>calcarius</etym>, <sense id="n6168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to burning lime</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">NEGOTIANS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 641, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">EXONERATOR,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1117, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
calcariensis: <entryFree id="n6169" type="hapax" key="calca_ri^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcārĭensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a limeburner</hi>, Cod. Th. 12, 1, 37.</sense></entryFree>
calcarius: <entryFree id="n6170" type="main" key="calca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. calx</etym>, <sense id="n6170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to lime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lime-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fornax,</quote> <trans><tr>a limekiln</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 38, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 53</bibl>.— Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6170.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">calcārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. fornax), <hi rend="ital">a lime-kiln</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de calcariā in carbonariam pervenire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Christ. 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6170.2" n="2" level="3"> (Sc. fodina.) <hi rend="ital">A lime-quarry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:8:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 8, § 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6170.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">calcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a limeburner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calcata: <entryFree id="n6171" type="main" key="calca_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, an uncertain reading in Auct. B. Hisp. 16, which, acc. to the context, signifies <sense id="n6171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the material for filling ditches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fascines;</hi> a marginal reading is crates; other MSS. cultatas and culcatas; v. Oud. in h.l.</sense></entryFree>
calcator: <entryFree id="n6172" type="main" key="calca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>calco</etym>, <sense id="n6172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who treads something</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">grapes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a treader of grapes</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:124" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Isa. 5, 16</bibl></cit>, n. 9.</sense></entryFree>
calcatorium: <entryFree id="n6173" type="main" key="calca_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id</etym>, <sense id="n6173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wine-press</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 18, 1</bibl> and 2; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 6, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calcatrix: <entryFree id="n6174" type="hapax" key="calca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <sense id="n6174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [calcator], <hi rend="ital">she who treads upon something</hi>, i. e. trop <hi rend="ital">despises it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she who contemns</hi>' mundi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 587</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calcatura: <entryFree id="n6175" type="hapax" key="calca_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>calco</etym>, <sense id="n6175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a treading</hi>: operarum, Vitr 10, 10, 1.</sense></entryFree>
calcatus: <entryFree id="n6176" type="main" key="calca_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. calco</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6177" type="main" key="calca_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>calco</etym>, <sense id="n6177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a treading</hi> (very rare). calcatu assiduo, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 13, 17</bibl>; Auct. Itin. Alex. M. 77 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
calceamen: <entryFree id="n6178" type="main" key="calce^a_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĕāmen</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">calcĭāmen</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>a collateral and rare form of calceamentum</etym>, <sense id="n6178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shoe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 7, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 8, 8, § 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calceamentarius: <entryFree id="n6179" type="gloss" key="calce^a_menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĕāmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(podhmata/rios</foreign>, caligarius, <sense id="n6179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shoemaker</hi>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
calceamentum: <entryFree id="n6180" type="main" key="calce^a_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĕāmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">calcĭām-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>calceo</etym>, <sense id="n6180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering for the foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shoe</hi> (v. also the class. co - ordinate forms calceamen and calceatus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">induere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 17, 27, § 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:65" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 17, 30, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:25:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 25, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calcearia: <entryFree id="n6181" type="main" key="calce^a_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĕārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n6181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [calceus], <hi rend="ital">a shoe-shop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:30:section=55" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, 30, § 55</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
calcearium: <entryFree id="n6182" type="main" key="calce^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĕārĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">calcĭār-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id., lit. <hi rend="ital">adj</hi> sc. argentum</etym>, <sense id="n6182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">money for shoes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoemoney</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8:section=14" default="NO">2, 15, 8, § 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calceator: <entryFree id="n6183" type="gloss" key="calce^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĕātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">calcĭāt-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>calceo</etym>, <sense id="n6183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shoemaker</hi>, Inscr Murat. 909, 12.</sense></entryFree>
calceatus: <entryFree id="n6184" type="main" key="calce^a_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĕātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">calcĭāt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. calceo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6185" type="main" key="calce^a_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĕātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">calcĭāt-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>calceo</etym>, <sense id="n6185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering for the foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sandal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoe</hi> (post-Aug. for the class. calceamentum): <cit><quote lang="la">in calceatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 57, 82, § 221</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:110" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 6, 59, § 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:222" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 16, 62, § 222</bibl>; 11, 45, 105, § 254; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calceo: <entryFree id="n6186" type="main" key="calceo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calceo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">calcio</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>calceus</etym>, <sense id="n6186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to furnish with shoes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put on shoes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shoe</hi> (class. in prose and poetry): calceati et vestiti, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 26, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cothurnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soccis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 41</bibl></cit>: calceandi pedes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 14, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 181</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fibrinis pellibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 9, 36, § 110</bibl></cit>: calceabat ipse sese, <cb n="CALC" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:21 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 21 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6186.1" n="B" level="2"> Of animals (whose feet were furnished with shoes to be taken off and put on, not shod as with us): <cit><quote lang="la">spartea quă animalia calceantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 24, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 54, 80, § 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceatis pedibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 58, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6186.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceati dentes,</quote> <trans><tr>facetè</tr>, <tr>well prepared for biting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceati pedes in praeparatione Evangelii,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>ready messengers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 6, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
calceolarius: <entryFree id="n6187" type="main" key="calce^o^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĕŏlārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">calcĭŏl-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>calceolus</etym>, <sense id="n6187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes shoes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shoemaker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calceolus: <entryFree id="n6188" type="main" key="calce^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>calceus</etym>, <sense id="n6188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small shoe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-boot</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">u(podhma/tion</foreign> (rare), *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 82</bibl>; Memmius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 261</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 208" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 208</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calces: <entryFree id="n6189" type="gloss" key="calces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calces</orth>, <sense id="n6189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leaden bottles</hi>, Paul. ex Fest. p 46 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
calceus: <entryFree id="n6190" type="main" key="calce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĕus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĭus</orth>; cf. Burm. and Oud. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 73</bibl>, and Calig. 52), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>calx</etym>, <sense id="n6190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shoe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a half-boot</hi> (covering the whole foot, while soleae, sandals, covered only the lower part, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22, 5</bibl>; v. solea, and cf. Liddell and Scott s. v. <foreign lang="greek">u(po/dhma</foreign>, and Dict. of Antiq.; <cit><quote lang="la">very freq. and class.): calcei muliebres sint an viriles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=40" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 40</bibl></cit> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">Titin. ap. Fest. s. v. mulleos, p. 142 ib. (Com. Rel. p. 128 Rib.): calcei habiles et apti ad pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcei et toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:30:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 30, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in calceo pulvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:137" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 137</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:74" default="NO">6, 3, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 32</bibl></cit>. laxatus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinister, dexter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pede major subvertet, minor uret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 42</bibl></cit>.—When the Romans reclined at table they laid aside their shoes; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, calceos poscere (like soleas poscere, v. solea),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to rise from table</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceos et vestimenta mutavit,</quote> <trans><tr>changed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; but also, because senators wore a peculiar kind of half - boot (cf. Becker, Gallus, III. p. 132, 2d ed.): calceos mutare, i e. <hi rend="ital">to become senator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 13, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calchas: <entryFree id="n6191" type="main" key="Calcha_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Calchās</orth>, <itype>antis</itype> (<sense id="n6191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Calchae, Gell. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 50</bibl> P.; <case>acc.</case> Calcham, Pac. and Plaut. ib.; <cit><quote lang="la">Calchanta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 11</bibl>, ext. 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 493</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Calchantem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N D. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 40, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 30, 63</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> Calchă, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 1, 48</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 702</bibl> P.; Ritschl prol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:page=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. p. 87</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/lxas</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">son of Thestor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the most distinguished seer among the Greeks before Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 182</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 737</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calchedon: <entryFree id="n6192" type="main" key="Calche_don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Calchēdon</orth>, v. Chalcedon.</entryFree>
calciarium: <entryFree id="n6193" type="main" key="calcia_rium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calciārium</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">calciātus</orth>, etc., v. calcearium, etc.</entryFree>
calcifraga: <entryFree id="n6194" type="main" key="calci^fra^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĭfrăga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. calx-frango</etym>, <sense id="n6194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb said to be a remedy for the stone</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">hartstongue</hi>: Asplenium scolopendrium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 51, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 150" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:153" default="NO">153</bibl>; cf. Dioscor<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:3:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calcio: <entryFree id="n6195" type="main" key="calcio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcio</orth>, v calceo.</entryFree>
calcitratus: <entryFree id="n6196" type="hapax" key="calci^tra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĭtrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>calcitro</etym>, <sense id="n6196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking with the heel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kicking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 174</bibl></cit>; cf. calcitro, I.</sense></entryFree>
calcitro: <entryFree id="n6197" type="main" key="calci^tro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĭtro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>1 calx</etym>. <sense id="n6197.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to strike with the heels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kick</hi>, of animals (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 16, 53, § 149</bibl>; cf. calcitratus.—</sense><sense id="n6197.1" n="B" level="2"> Trop, <hi rend="ital">to resist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be stubborn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refractory</hi>: calcitrat, respuit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6197.2" n="C" level="2"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">calcitrare contra stimulum,</quote> <trans><tr>to kick against the pricks</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26, 14</bibl>; cf. 1. calx. —*</sense><sense id="n6197.3" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to strike convulsively with the feet</hi>, of one dying, Ov M. 12, 240.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6198" type="main" key="calci^tro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĭtro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. calcitro</etym>. <sense id="n6198.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who strikes with his heels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kicker</hi>: equus mordax, calcitro, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 45, 2</bibl> (Sat. Men. 81, 3).—</sense><sense id="n6198.1" n="II" level="1"> Of men, <hi rend="ital">a boisterous fellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a blusterer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calcitrosus: <entryFree id="n6199" type="main" key="calci^tro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcĭtrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. calcitro</etym>, <sense id="n6199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">kicking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apt to kick</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:4" default="NO">21, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calco: <entryFree id="n6200" type="main" key="calco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. calx</etym>, <sense id="n6200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tread something</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tread under foot.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6200.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n6200.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very freq.; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.)' astructos morientum acervos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 391</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcata vipera,</quote> <trans><tr>trodden upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 23</bibl></cit>; 12, 391; <cit><quote lang="la">13, 804: alius manum aeger, ut pede ac vestigio Caesaris calcaretur, orabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cineres ossaque legionum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcata lacinia togae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl></cit>: uvam, <pb n="268" /> <cb n="CALC" /> <hi rend="ital">to tread grapes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 112 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:54:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 54, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:897" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 897</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 15, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">To stamp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mortario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum ferratis vectibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 52, § 173</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6200.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6200.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To tread down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to oppress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trample upon</hi> (the figure is taken from a victorious warrior who tramples upon his prostrate opponents): <cit><quote lang="la">amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 11, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:86" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:16:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas nostra in foro obteritur et calcatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcatum jus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 125</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6200.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To scorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spurn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insultetque rogis, calcet et ossa mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid quasi fastidiendo calcare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcatum foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:208" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 208</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6200.6" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n6200.7" n="A" level="2"> Of objects in space, <hi rend="ital">to tread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass over</hi>: calcanda semel via leti, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 118, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulos, litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durum aequor,</quote> <trans><tr>the frozen sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons Hon. 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcatos lucos Jovi,</quote> <trans><tr>frequented by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:675" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 675</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6200.8" n="B" level="2"> Of the cock, <hi rend="ital">to tread</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6200.9" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to press close together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to press in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleas in orculam calcato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 117 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tomentum in culcita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=167" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 167</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 52, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 52, § 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 244</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calcularius: <entryFree id="n6201" type="hapax" key="calcu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>calculus</etym>, <sense id="n6201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to calculation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">error,</quote> <trans><tr>an error in reckoning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:8:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
calculatio: <entryFree id="n6202" type="main" key="calcu^la_ti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>calculo</etym>, <sense id="n6202.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a computation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calculation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckoning</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Ep. 1, 10</bibl>; Ven. ad Syagr. Ep. 5, 6.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6203" type="hapax" key="calcu^la_ti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>calculus</etym>, <sense id="n6203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">calculus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gravel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stone</hi>, a disease, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:60" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calculator: <entryFree id="n6204" type="main" key="calcu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>calculo</etym>, <sense id="n6204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a computer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teacher of arithmetic</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">logisth/s</foreign> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:62:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 62, 4</bibl>; Acron. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6</bibl>. 72; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 3, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6204.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A book-keeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accountant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:7:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 1, 7, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:15:section=5" default="NO">27, 1, 15, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calculatorius: <entryFree id="n6205" type="main" key="calcu^la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcŭlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>calculator</etym>, <sense id="n6205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to an accountant</hi>: tabula, Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:73" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calculensis: <entryFree id="n6206" type="hapax" key="calcu^lensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcŭlensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>calculus</etym>, <sense id="n6206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to stones</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus purpurarum a calculo maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 37, 61, § 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
calculo: <entryFree id="n6207" type="main" key="calcu^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to calculate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckon</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n6207.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 131.—</sense><sense id="n6207.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to consider as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to esteem</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6208" type="main" key="calcu^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcŭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. calculo</etym>, <sense id="n6208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a computer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accountant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ord. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ord. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> II. p. 268, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calculosus: <entryFree id="n6209" type="main" key="calcu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>calculus</etym>. <sense id="n6209.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of small stones</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pebbles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pebbly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gravelly</hi> (post - Aug.): pomum, Cloat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 3:11:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 14, 49, § 170</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6209.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Afficted with calculus</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26</bibl>, n. 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 9, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 150" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 150</bibl> and 153; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calculus: <entryFree id="n6210" type="main" key="calcu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. calx; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=46" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 46</bibl></etym>. <sense id="n6210.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a small stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pebble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjectis in os calculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthenes calculos linguā volvens dicere domi solebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argilla et dumosis calculus arvis,</quote> <trans><tr>gravel in the thorny fields</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 180</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:124" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 9, 33, § 124</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6210.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tenui venulā per calculos fluunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6210.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n6210.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A stone in the bladder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kidneys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the gravel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 86, § 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comminuere et eicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 4, 13, § 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">eicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 91, § 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exturbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 10, 42, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 21, 29, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 8, 80, § 153</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6210.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A draughtsman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stone</hi> or <hi rend="ital">counter used in playing draughts.</hi> called duodecim scripta, in which, as in chess, by driving a piece from one square to another, the person beaten could not finally move at all (ad incitas redactus est): <cit><quote lang="la">in lusu duodecim scriptorum cum prior calculum promovisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 207</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 357</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:478" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 478</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calculorum ludus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5:165" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5, 165</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6210.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: calculum reducere, <hi rend="ital">to take back a move</hi>: tibi concedo, quod in XII. scriptis solemus, ut calculum reducas, si te alicujus dati paenitet, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 170, 28</bibl> (Hortens. Fragm. 51 B. and K.): quā re nunc saltem ad illos calculos revertamur, quos tum abjecimus,<cb n="CALE" />  i. e. <hi rend="ital">those principles of action</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 12, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6210.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A stone used in reckoning on the counting-board;</hi> hence meton., <hi rend="ital">a reckoning, computing, calculating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calculi et rationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:35" default="NO">7, 4, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:14" default="NO">8, 3, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 11, 18 Spald.: calculos subducere,</quote> <trans><tr>to compute</tr>, <tr>reckon</tr>, <tr>cast up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:20:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de posteris cogitanti in condicionibus deligendus ponendus est calculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam ad calculos vocare,</quote> <trans><tr>to subject to an accurate reckoning</tr>, <tr>hold to a strict account</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad calculos eum respublica vocet,</quote> <trans><tr>settles accounts</tr>, <tr>reckons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revocare aliquid ad calculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio calculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6210.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquā re parem calculum ponere,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>to render equal for equal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ego movi calculos,</quote> <trans><tr>considerations which I have suggested</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6210.8" n="D" level="2"> In the most ancient per., <hi rend="ital">a stone used in voting; a vote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffrage;</hi> a white one for assent or acquittal, a black for denial or condemnation; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:41 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 41 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 242</bibl>.— Hence judicialis, Imp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Cod. 3:1:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Cod. 3, 1, 12</bibl>: deteriorem reportare, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an adverse decision</hi>, Impp. Diocl. et Max. Cod. 7, 62, 10: <cit><quote lang="la">calculis omnibus,</quote> <trans><tr>by a unanimous vote</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 191, 21</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si modo tu fortasse errori nostro album calculum adjeceris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>approve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6210.9" n="E" level="2"> The Thracians were accustomed to preserve the recollection of fortunate occurrences by white stones, and of unfortunate by black, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 40, 41, § 131</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6210.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">o diem laetum, notandumque mihi candidissimo calculo!</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a most happy day!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:34:9:section=53" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 34, 9, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 1 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6210.11" n="F" level="1"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">a small weight</hi>: calculus constat ex granis ciceris duobus, Auct. Ponder ap. Goes. Agr. p. 322 (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 25, 8</bibl>, called calcus).</sense></entryFree>
calcus: <entryFree id="n6211" type="main" key="calcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n6211.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
calda: <entryFree id="n6212" type="main" key="calda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. calidus, I. B. 1.</entryFree>
caldamentum: <entryFree id="n6213" type="main" key="calda_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caldāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>calidus</etym>, <sense id="n6213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fermentation</hi> (late Lat.) <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caldariola: <entryFree id="n6214" type="main" key="calda_ri^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caldārĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>caldaria</etym>, <sense id="n6214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small vessel for heating fluids</hi>, Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:47" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 47</bibl> dub. (Jan. calvariolas).</sense></entryFree>
caldarius: <entryFree id="n6215" type="main" key="calda_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caldārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">călĭd-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caldus = calidus</etym>, <sense id="n6215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suitable for warming.</hi> cella, <hi rend="ital">a warm bath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6215.1" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n6215.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">caldārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n6215.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A warm bath</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6215.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A pot</hi> for boiling, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6215.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">caldārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n6215.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A hot bath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6215.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A room containing warm water for bathing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6215.8" n="II" level="1"> Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">calidaria maltha,</quote> <trans><tr>for plastering the walls in baths</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 41, 1</bibl></cit>: caldarium aes, <hi rend="ital">that is prepared by heat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fusion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 20, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caldius: <entryFree id="n6216" type="main" key="Caldi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caldĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>calda</etym>, <sense id="n6216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nickname formed from Claudius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and given to the emperor Tiberius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of his fondness for drink</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42</bibl>; cf. Biberius and Mero.</sense></entryFree>
caldor: <entryFree id="n6217" type="main" key="caldor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caldor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>caldus = calidus</etym>, <sense id="n6217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">warmth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heat</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:41:1" default="NO">1, 41, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:55:6" default="NO">1, 55, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:4:4" default="NO">19, 4, 4</bibl> and 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 240</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caldum: <entryFree id="n6218" type="main" key="caldum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caldum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v caldus.</entryFree>
caldus: <entryFree id="n6219" type="main" key="caldus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caldus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v calidus.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6220" type="main" key="Caldus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caldus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv 2, 9, 28</bibl>.—Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Caelius Caldus, quaestor A. U. C. 704,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 19</bibl></cit> tit.</sense></entryFree>
caledonia: <entryFree id="n6221" type="main" key="Ca^le_do^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Călēdŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n6221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Călī-</orth> <etym>cf. Welsh celydd, a woody shelter, and Lat. celo</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kalhdoni/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the province of the ancient Britons</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Highlands in the northern part of Scotland</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25</bibl>; 31.—</sense><sense id="n6221.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n6221.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Călē-dŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Caledonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 16, 30, § 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:17:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britanni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:44:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 44, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6221.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Călēdŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Caledonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">angulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Călēdŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a people in the Scottish Highlands</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Const. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calefacio: <entryFree id="n6222" type="main" key="ca^le^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĕ-făcĭo</orth>, or contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">calfăcĭo</orth> (as calidus = caldus, calidarius = caldarius, etc.), <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (in the time of Quint. the contracted form seems to have been the prevailing one, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 21</bibl>; <cb n="CALE" /> also <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 220</bibl> P. gives as <sense id="n6222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> calfio. In the poets usage varies according to the demands of the verse; <cit><quote lang="la">e. g., cālfācìt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:698" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 698</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">cālfăcienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 214</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">cālfācti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 48</bibl></cit>, and călĕfēcit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 687</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">călēfacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 269 al.</bibl> In prose writers—e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 58</bibl>—the best MSS. vary between the two forms. —<hi rend="ital">Imperat.</hi> calface, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 2</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> regularly calefio; <cit><quote lang="la">once by a solecism calefacientur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">concalefaciuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>) [caleo-facio]. </sense><sense id="n6222.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make warm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to warm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heat</hi>: ventus ubi percaluit calefecitque omnia, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 687</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolium calfacito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 69, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad calefaciendum corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">igne focum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:698" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 698</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamistris calefactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=129" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 129</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">abi intro ac jube huic aquam calefieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calefieri jussi reliquias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces calefiunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balineum calfieri jubebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Algenti manus est calfacienda sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovum cum porri suco calefactum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora calefacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6222.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6222.3" n="A" level="2"> In colloquial lang., <hi rend="ital">to trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calface hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: si Parthi vos nihil calfaciunt, nos hic frigore frigescimus, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gabinium calefecerat Memmius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6222.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the passions, <hi rend="ital">to heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rouse up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calefacta corda tumultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 269</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino calefacta Venus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 182</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6222.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pursue something with zeal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum aleatorium calfecimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.</sense></entryFree>
calefactabilis: <entryFree id="n6223" type="main" key="ca^le^facta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĕfactābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>calefacio</etym>, <sense id="n6223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be warmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made hot</hi>: ignis, Boëth. ap. Aristot. Interpr. p. 279; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> p. 450.</sense></entryFree>
calefactio: <entryFree id="n6224" type="main" key="ca^le^facti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĕfactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a warming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heating</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">balnei publici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 18, § 4</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">calefactiones thermarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
calefacto: <entryFree id="n6225" type="main" key="ca^le^facto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĕfacto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n6225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. act.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to make warm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to warm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heat</hi> (very rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n6225.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: ahenum, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 169</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 12</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n6225.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem virgis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
calefactorius: <entryFree id="n6226" type="main" key="ca^le^facto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĕfactōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a warming</hi> or <hi rend="ital">heating power</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 38</bibl>; Theod. Prisc. de Diaeta, 10.</sense></entryFree>
calefactus: <entryFree id="n6227" type="main" key="ca^le^factus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĕfactus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">calfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. calefacio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6228" type="main" key="ca^le^factus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĕfactus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">calfac-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>calefacio</etym>, <sense id="n6228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a warming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heating</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">faucium tumorem calfactu obiter fovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 48</bibl></cit>; Lact. Opif. Dei, 14, 5.</sense></entryFree>
calefio: <entryFree id="n6229" type="main" key="ca^le^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĕfīo</orth>, <itype>fĭĕri</itype>, v. calefacio.</entryFree>
calendae: <entryFree id="n6230" type="main" key="Ca^lendae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Călendae</orth>, v. Kalendae.</entryFree>
calendaris: <entryFree id="n6231" type="main" key="Ca^lenda_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Călendāris</orth>, v. Kalendaris.</entryFree>
calendarium: <entryFree id="n6232" type="main" key="ca^lenda_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călendārĭum</orth>, v. kalendarium.</entryFree>
