calentum: <entryFree id="n6233" type="main" key="Calentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Calentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Call-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n6233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Hispania Baetica, now prob. <hi rend="ital">Cuzalla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 14, 49, § 171</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Callenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Calentum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calenum: <entryFree id="n6234" type="main" key="Ca^le_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Călēnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Călēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Cales.</entryFree>
caleo: <entryFree id="n6235" type="main" key="ca^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĕo</orth>, <itype>ui, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (<sense id="n6235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. fut. act.</hi> călĭtūrus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 590</bibl>: caleor = caleo, Caper. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 797</bibl> P.; prob. only in reference to the <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> caletur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 46</bibl>) [etym. dub.; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ske/llw</foreign>, <foreign lang="greek">sklhro/s</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">to be warm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glow</hi> (object.; opp. frigere, to be cold; while aestuare, to feel, experience warmth; opp. algere, to feel cold; cf. Doed. Syn. III. p. 89). </sense><sense id="n6235.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: calet aqua; <cit><quote lang="la">eamus hinc intro ut laves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentiri hoc putat, ut calere ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os calet tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sole calente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae alio sole calentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calens favilla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ture calent arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calentibus aris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calituras ignibus aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:590" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttae calentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:283" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 283</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:671" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 671</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulphur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 86</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> sometimes for aestuare, subject., <hi rend="ital">to feel warm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fortunati sunt fabri ferrarii, Qui aput carbones adsident! semper calent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:218" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:216" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 216</bibl></cit>; cf.: caluit et hodie Faustina, Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 5:11" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 5, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6235.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6235.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To glow</hi> in mind, <hi rend="ital">to be roused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflamed</hi> <pb n="269" /> <cb n="CALI" /> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">in prose less freq. than ardere): (leones) permixtā caede calentes,</quote> <trans><tr>inflamed by indiscriminate slaughter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1312</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 643</bibl>; Hirt. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">admirando, irridendo calebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:66:234" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 66, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re frigidissimā cales, in ferventissimā cales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 15, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animis jam calentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani calentes adhuc ab recenti pugnā proelium ineunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 39, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at ille utendum animis dum spe calerent ratus,</quote> <trans><tr>are animated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminā calere,</quote> <trans><tr>to become enamored of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycidan quo calet juventus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 571</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:32:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 32, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">igne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:55:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 55, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderio Conjugis abrepti,</quote> <trans><tr>to be inflamed with desire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 731</bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">to be troubled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexed</hi>: haec velim explices; <cit><quote lang="la">etsi te ipsum istic jam calere puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 8, 6, 51</bibl>: alio mentis morbo, <hi rend="ital">to labor under</hi> (the figure derived from fever, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 80</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so of the passion for scribbling: mutavit mentem populus levis et calet uno Scribendi studio,</quote> <trans><tr>now the rage for writing and versifying is the general disease of our people</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narratur et prisci Catonis Saepe mero caluisse virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 21, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:263" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 263</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6235.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubas audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:261" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 261</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Nupt. Hon. 10, 287</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 29</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6235.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nova lucra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 62.—</sense><sense id="n6235.6" n="B" level="2"> Of abstract things, <hi rend="ital">to be carried on warmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be urged on zealously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud crimen de nummis caluit re recenti, nunc in causā refrixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:23:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia calent, i. e. magnā diligentiā et ardore exercentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calebant nundinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posteaquam satis calere res Rubrio visa est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>seemed sufficiently ripe for execution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneris bella calent,</quote> <trans><tr>rage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:53" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et mixtus lacrimis caluit dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:383" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 383</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6235.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be yet warm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">new</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fresh</hi> (the figure taken from food): <cit><quote lang="la">at enim nihil est, nisi, dum calet, hic agitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: illi rumores de comitiis caluerunt, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6235.8" n="D" level="2"> (Effectus pro causā.) Of a place, <hi rend="ital">to be eagerly sought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be frequented</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ungularum pulsibus calens Hister,</quote> <trans><tr>often trod</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cales: <entryFree id="n6236" type="main" key="Ca^les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căles</orth>, ium. <gen>f.</gen> (as <number>sing.</number> in <case>acc.</case> Calen, as if from Cale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:525" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 525</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Călēnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 60</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*kalhsi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n6236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Southern Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for its good wine</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Calvi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 728</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:514" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 514</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6236.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Călēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Cales</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Calenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">municipium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falx,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31, 9</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n6236.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Călēnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vinum), <hi rend="ital">Calenian wine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">molle Calenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:69" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6236.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Călēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cales</hi>: C. Gracchus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 3</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 13, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calesco: <entryFree id="n6237" type="main" key="ca^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n6237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [caleo], <hi rend="ital">to grow warm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hot.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6237.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">(vortex) suā cum Mobilitate calescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calescere vel apricatione vel igni, umbris aquisve refrigerari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 138</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda calescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 310</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6237.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the mind, <hi rend="ital">to become excited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be inflamed;</hi> esp. with love (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 5</bibl> Don.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo propius nunc es, flammā propiore calesco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 177</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 372</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est deus in nobis! agitante calescimus illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caletes: <entryFree id="n6238" type="main" key="Cale_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Calētes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Calēti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Belgic Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:ib. 8:7" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> ib. 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caletranus: <entryFree id="n6239" type="main" key="Caletra_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caletrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n6239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Caletra in Etruria</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:55:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 55, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calfacio: <entryFree id="n6240" type="main" key="calfacio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calfacio</orth>, v. calefacio.</entryFree>
calicata: <entryFree id="n6241" type="gloss" key="ca^li^ca_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭcāta aedĭfĭcia</orth>, <itype>calce polita</itype>, <sense id="n6241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plastered with lime</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:47" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 47</bibl> Müll.; cf. decalicatum.</sense></entryFree>
calicellus: <entryFree id="n6242" type="main" key="ca^li^cellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭcellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>calix</etym>, <sense id="n6242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little cup</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caliclarium: <entryFree id="n6243" type="gloss" key="ca^licla_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căliclārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <foreign lang="greek">pothrioqh/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n6243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where cups stand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cupboard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sideboard</hi>, Gloss. Gr. Lat. <cb n="CALI" /></sense></entryFree>
caliculus: <entryFree id="n6244" type="main" key="ca^li^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>calix</etym>, <sense id="n6244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small cup</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 108, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 93</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 7, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6244.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a little inkstand</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calida: <entryFree id="n6245" type="main" key="ca^li^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. calidus, I. B. 1.</entryFree>
calidarium: <entryFree id="n6246" type="main" key="ca^li^da_rium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭdārium</orth>, etc., v. caldarius, B. 2.</entryFree>
calide: <entryFree id="n6247" type="main" key="ca^li^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. calidus <sense id="n6247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
calidius: <entryFree id="n6248" type="main" key="Ca^li^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Călĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n6248.1" n="I" level="1"> M. Calidius, <hi rend="ital">an orator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6248.2" n="II" level="1"> Cn. Calidius, <hi rend="ital">a Roman knight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the father of a senator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plundered by Verres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:20:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 20, § 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6248.3" n="III" level="1"> Q. Calidius, <hi rend="ital">the father of</hi> I., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 13, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 25, § 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calidonia: <entryFree id="n6249" type="main" key="Ca^li_do^nia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Călīdŏnia</orth>, etc., v. Caledonia, etc.</entryFree>
calidus: <entryFree id="n6250" type="main" key="ca^li^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭdus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">caldus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (contr. access. form caldus in the anteAug. per. is freq. only in Cato and Varr.; Lucr. and Cic. use only calidus; acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 19</bibl>, caldus appears to have been predom. in the Aug. per., though used by Aug. poets only when demanded by the rules of prosody, as <sense id="n6250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> caldior, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 53</bibl>) [caleo, like fervidus, frigidus, from ferveo, etc., aridus from areo, etc.], <hi rend="ital">warm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hot.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6250.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons luce diurnă Frigidus, et calidus nocturno tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:850" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 850</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:749" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 749</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:888" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 888</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora secreta omnino calidi vaporis,</quote> <trans><tr>devoid of warmth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:844" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 844</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:858" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 858</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 127</bibl>; 3, 216; 5, 568; 5, 595; 5, 796; 6, 859; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 949 al.: fervor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 657</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:604" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 604</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fornaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lavacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:800" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 800</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:856" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 856</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit>.—As epitheton ornans with ignis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 648</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1087" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 1087</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:431" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 431</bibl>; 6, 516; 6, 689; <cit><quote lang="la">with flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:903" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 903</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne quod est calidum et igneum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calidior est enim, vel potius ardentior, animus, quam hic aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:18:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calidissimae hiemes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 765" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 765</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 54, 75, § 152</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 27</bibl>.—Contr. form in agro caldo, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sole caldo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calda puls,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, § 127</bibl></cit> Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caldior est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 53</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Prop. nom.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Călĭdae Ăquae</orth>, = /(<foreign lang="greek">gdata *qerma/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Hot Springs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bathing place in Zeugitana</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Hammam Gurbos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 24, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6250.2" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n6250.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭda</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">calda</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. aqua), <hi rend="ital">warm water</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 38, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 2, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">contr. calda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30:5" default="NO">6, 30, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 41, § 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 77:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 77, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:83:5" default="NO">83, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6250.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭ-dum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">caldum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">to\ qermo/n</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">u(/dwr</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a hot drink</hi> (a mixture of wine and boiling hot water), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calix a caldo, quod in eo calda puls apponebatur et caldum eo bibebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=127" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 127</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n6250.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6250.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">fiery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spirited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impassioned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehement</hi> (of living beings, only in the poets): <cit><quote lang="la">equus calidus animis,</quote> <trans><tr>of a fiery spirit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redemptor,</quote> <trans><tr>eager</tr>, <tr>active</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calidus juventă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 14, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caldior est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rixa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 27, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6250.7" n="2" level="3"> Esp. freq. (also in prose): consilium, of a conclusion made under excitement, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rash</hi> = temerarium, praeceps (v. Ruhnk. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 89</bibl>; Doed. Syn. II. p. 124; cf. also Lidd. and Scott under <foreign lang="greek">qermo/s</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">reperias multos, quibus periculosa et calida consilia quietis et cogitatis et splendidiora et majora videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 82</bibl></cit>; Hirt. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitabanturque pro ingenio ducis consilia calidiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia calida et audacia primă specie laeta, tractatu dura, eventu tristia esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 32, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 89</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">calidoque habitata Gradivo Pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:337" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 337</bibl></cit> Drak. ad loc.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6250.8" n="3" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, Caldus (<hi rend="ital">hot-head</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">idcirco aliquem Caldum (al. Calidium) vocari, quod temerario et repentino consilio sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:9:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 9, 28</bibl></cit>.—So C. Caelius Caldus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6250.9" n="B" level="2"> With the prevailing idea of haste, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prompt</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only anteclass.): huic homini opus est quadraginta minis celeriter calidis,</quote> <trans><tr>quickly procured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: pedes, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 263, 20</bibl>.—Esp.: consilium, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready device</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reperiamus aliquid calidi conducibilis consili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reperi, comminiscere, cedo calidum consilium cito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit> Brix. ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">calidum hercle audivi esse optumum mendacium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 136</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <cb n="CALI" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promptly</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">calide quicquid acturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caliendrum: <entryFree id="n6251" type="main" key="ca^li^endrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭendrum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭandrĭum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 209</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ka/lluntron</foreign>, ornament</etym>, <sense id="n6251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a high head-dress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made of layers of false hair; a head-dress worn by Roman women</hi> (very rare): caliendrum <foreign lang="greek">ko/smion kefqlh=s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 48</bibl> (caliendrum hoc est galericulum, Porphyr., acc. to whom it was also used by Varro; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Men. 95:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Men. 95, 10</bibl>); Arn. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caliga: <entryFree id="n6252" type="main" key="ca^li^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. calceus, from calx</etym>, <sense id="n6252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shoe of leather</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">that worn by the Roman soldiers</hi> (cf. Dio, 48, 12; Smith, Antiq., and Becker, Gall. III. p. 134, 2d ed.), <hi rend="ital">a half-boot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a soldier</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s boot.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6252.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 10, 3</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 52</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:24" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 24</bibl>; Edict. Diocl. p. 241.—</sense><sense id="n6252.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">military service</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 44, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 17:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:16:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 5, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 445, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caligaris: <entryFree id="n6253" type="main" key="ca^li^ga_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭgāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caliga</etym>, <sense id="n6253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the</hi> caliga or <hi rend="ital">soldier</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s boot</hi> (access. form of the foll.): <cit><quote lang="la">clavus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 18, 33, § 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:94" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 46, § 94</bibl>: formae, Edict. Diocl. p. 23.</sense></entryFree>
caligarius: <entryFree id="n6254" type="main" key="ca^li^ga_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭgārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the soldier</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s boot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 143</bibl></cit>.—Hence, with sutor, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 649, 1</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭgārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a maker of soldiers</hi>' <hi rend="ital">boots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shoemaker</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 33</bibl>; Firm. Matth. 3, 12; Inscr. Spon. Misc. 220.</sense></entryFree>
caligatio: <entryFree id="n6255" type="hapax" key="ca_li_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cālīgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. caligo</etym>, <sense id="n6255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">darkness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mistiness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caligatus: <entryFree id="n6256" type="main" key="ca^li^ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caliga</etym>, <sense id="n6256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearing soldiers</hi>' <hi rend="ital">boots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">booted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:3:9" default="NO">48, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 279, 3</bibl>.—Of a peasant <hi rend="ital">in heavy shoes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brogans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:322" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 322</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6256.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭgātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. miles), <hi rend="ital">a common soldier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a private</hi>, = gregarius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caligineus: <entryFree id="n6257" type="hapax" key="ca_li_gi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cālīgĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. caligo</etym>, <sense id="n6257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caliginosus: <entryFree id="n6258" type="main" key="ca_li_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cālīgĭnōsus</orth> (post-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cālīgōsus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 803</bibl>; cf. Kopp. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, § 67</bibl>; Ven. Fort. Carm. 5, 4, 25), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of mist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covered with mist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi> (rare, but class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">caelum et umidum et caliginosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscurior et quasi caliginosa stella (opp. illustris et pellucida),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 57, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>, ext. 1.— </sense><sense id="n6258.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>: nox, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an uncertain future</hi>, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caliginosissima quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 7</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> not in use.</sense></entryFree>
caligo: <entryFree id="n6259" type="main" key="ca_li_go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cālīgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">call-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root cal-, cover; cf.: oc-culo, clam, cella</etym>, <sense id="n6259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thick atmosphere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vapor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fog</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">suffundere caelum caligine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 479</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:461" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 461</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:92" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ignis) piceă crassus caligine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 309</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">densa caligo occaecaverat diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumidam a terră exhalari caliginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 42, 42, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caligo aestuosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:53" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 53</bibl></cit> (for which, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nebulosus aestus): pruinae et caligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 9, 2</bibl>.—Also in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter caligines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6259.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6259.2" n="A" level="2"> (Causa pro effectu.) <hi rend="ital">Darkness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscurity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloom</hi> (produced by mist, fog, etc.; freq. with tenebrae; <cit><quote lang="la">class. in prose and poetry): mi ob oculos caligo obstitit, Plaut Mil. 2, 4, 51: cum altitudo caliginem oculis obfudisset,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>had caused dizziness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 45, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat in tantā calligine major usus aurium quam oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 5, 3</bibl></cit> Weissenb.: noctem insequentem eadem calligc obtinuit; <cit><quote lang="la">sole orto est discussa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox terram caligine texit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:853" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 853</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:649" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 649</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeca noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecae umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 305</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 203</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam simul agnorunt inter caliginis umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara obscurā caligine tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=194" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 194</bibl></cit>.—With tenebrae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:17:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 17, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Comm. 16</bibl>.—In later writers also with a <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caligo tenebrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 18:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 18, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 472" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 472</bibl> Heins.; <cit><quote lang="la">and inversely: tenebris illunae caliginis impeditus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 214</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6259.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6259.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">mental blindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dulness of perception</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod videbam equidem, sed quasi per caliginem: praestrinxerat aciem animi D. Bruti salus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 43</bibl>: adhuc tamen <pb n="270" /> <cb n="CALL" /> per caliginem video, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 8, 8</bibl>: caecā mentem caligine consitus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 207</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augustus... omnibus omnium gentium viris magnitudine suā inducturus caliginem,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw into the shade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:37:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 37, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6259.5" n="2" level="3"> Of dark, difficult circumstances, <hi rend="ital">calamity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affliction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide nunc caliginem temporum illorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superioris anni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> post Red. in Sen. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an qui etesiis, qui per cursum rectum regnum tenere non potuerunt, nunc caecis tenebris et caligine se Alexandriam perventuros arbitrati sunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:17:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 17, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa omnis pecunia latuit in illā caligine ac tenebris, quae totam rem publicam tum occuparant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:76:section=177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 76, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce illa tempestas, caligo bonorum, tenebrae rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum caliginis, tantum perturbationis offusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam scelerum offusa caligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6259.6" n="C" level="2"> In medic. lang., as a disease of the eyes, <hi rend="ital">dim-sightedness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weakness of the eyes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6</bibl>, n. 32; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 7, 26, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:254" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 23, 95, § 254</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:144" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 13, 92, § 144</bibl>; 32, 9, 31, § 97; 34, 11, 27, § 114; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 179" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6260" type="main" key="ca_li_go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cālīgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>1. caligo</etym>. <sense id="n6260.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To emit vapor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">steam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to steam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reek</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes aestate vaporatis, hieme frigidis nebulis caligent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aram tenui caligans vestiet umbrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=205" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 205</bibl></cit> (449); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem quae nunc Mortalis hebetat visus tibi et umida circum Caligat, nubem eripiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 606</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6260.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6260.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be involved in darkness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caligare oculos,</quote> <trans><tr>darkness covers the eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 468</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:95" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 95</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6260.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">altae caligantesque fenestrae,</quote> <trans><tr>dizzy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:31" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6260.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the understanding, <hi rend="ital">to be blind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be surrounded by darkness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grope about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbatae caligant vela carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:238" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caligare ad pervidendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus inhorrescit ad subita, et caligabit, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 57:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 57, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex caligare alto in solio, nec pondera regni posse pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:88" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 88</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">caligare in sole,</quote> <trans><tr>to grope in broad daylight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6260.5" n="B" level="2"> In medic. lang., of the eyes, <hi rend="ital">to suffer from weakness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be weak</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 87, § 239</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 147</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the person, <hi rend="ital">to be dim-sighted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caligans Thyestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:4:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 184" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 184</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caligosus: <entryFree id="n6261" type="main" key="ca_li_go_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cālīgōsus</orth>, v. caliginosus.</entryFree>
caligula: <entryFree id="n6262" type="main" key="ca^li^gu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călĭgŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>caliga</etym>, <sense id="n6262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small military boot;</hi> only post-class. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 7, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 128</bibl>; Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:67" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 67</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6262.1" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">nom. propr.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Călĭgŭ-la</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a cognomen of the successor of Tiberius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">since from his earliest youth he was engaged in military service;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calim: <entryFree id="n6263" type="main" key="calim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calim</orth>, v. clam.</entryFree>
calingae: <entryFree id="n6264" type="main" key="Calingae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Calingae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:64 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 64 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:72" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 20, 23, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2, 2, § 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calingii:
<entryFree id="n6265" type="main" key="Calingii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Calingii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 159</bibl>.
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">caliptra</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of covering for the head</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=47:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 47, 5</bibl> Müll. [ = <foreign lang="greek">kalu/ptra</foreign>].</sense></entryFree>
calix: <entryFree id="n6266" type="greek" key="ca^lix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root cal-, cover; cf. caligo; Germ. Kelch</etym>. <sense id="n6266.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cup</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goblet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a drinking-vessel</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">ku/lic</foreign> poculi genus, quod nos una littera immutata calicem dicimus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:98" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 33, 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33</bibl>, prooem. 2, § 5; 36, 40, 66, § 195; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:145" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 145</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6266.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wine</hi>, = vinum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 19 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6266.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cooking-vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pot</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 39, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:27:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, 27, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:509" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 509</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6266.3" n="III" level="1"> Of aqueducts, <hi rend="ital">a small pipe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 36" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calla: <entryFree id="n6267" type="main" key="calla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calla</orth>, v. calsa.</entryFree>
callaecia: <entryFree id="n6268" type="main" key="Callaecia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callaecia</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Callaecus</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Calla-icus</orth>, v. Gallaeci.</entryFree>
callais: <entryFree id="n6269" type="greek" key="callais"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callaïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kallai/+s</foreign>, <sense id="n6269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-green precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the turquoise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 151</bibl> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 20</bibl> called callaica).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6269.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">callăĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">turquoisecolored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:139" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 139</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">callăĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone of a pale-green color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:110 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 33, § 110 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:147" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10, 54, § 147</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 151</bibl>. <cb n="CALL" /></sense></entryFree>
callarias: <entryFree id="n6270" type="greek" key="calla^ri^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callărĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kallari/as</foreign>, <sense id="n6270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of codfish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 28, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:146" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 146</bibl> Sillig (Jan. collyri, collyris).</sense></entryFree>
callens: <entryFree id="n6271" type="main" key="callens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. <itype>calleo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
callenter: <entryFree id="n6272" type="main" key="callenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. calleo, <sense id="n6272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
calleo: <entryFree id="n6273" type="main" key="calle^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n6273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [callum]. </sense><sense id="n6273.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6273.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be callous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be thickskinned</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">plagis costae callent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 258, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">callent rure manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 260</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 84, § 211</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6273.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n6273.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be hardened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfeeling</hi>: in illis rebus exercitatus animus callere jam debet atque omnia minoris existimare, Serv. Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 2</bibl>; cf. callisco.—</sense><sense id="n6273.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be practised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be wise by experience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be skilful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">versed in;</hi> in a pun on the literal sense A. supra: <cit><quote lang="la">callum aprugnum callere aeque non sinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> v. 1; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes homines ad suum quaestum callent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 40</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 62</bibl>: callidus ad quaestum); <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 2, 4</bibl>: melius quam viri callent mulieres, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 257, 31</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 28 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">satin' astu et fallendo callet?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 258, 6 (Trag. Rel. v. 475 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod periti sumus in vitā atque usu callemus magis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 258, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in re navali, cujus esset ignarus, offendisset, eo plus in ea, quorum usu calleret, spei nactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 26, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cottidiano usu ejus (negotii) callebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:12:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 38, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:86" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 29, 46, § 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">augurandi studio Galli praeter caeteros callent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:4:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: arte, Ser. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 258, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellis callere,</quote> <trans><tr>by military experience</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:90 sq" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 90 sq.</bibl></cit>: fidibus, App. Flor. n. 18.—</sense><sense id="n6273.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to know by experience</hi> or <hi rend="ital">practice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to know</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have the knowledge of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understand</hi> (freq., esp. in the poets; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic. very rare): memini et scio et calleo et commemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta perdocte callet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus sensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: istaec malitiosa non tam calleo, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 482, 10</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 124 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">in colubras callet cantiunculam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:ib. 482:9" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> ib. 482, 9</bibl></cit> (Com. Rel. v. 118 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 14, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanas rusticasque res pariter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legitimum sonum digitis callemus et aure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:274 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 274 al.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n6273.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object: multaque de rerum mixturā dicere callent, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:978" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 978</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:142" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:105" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 105</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6273.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: quem Marcellini consiliarium fuisse callebant, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 258, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6273.9" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pacto id fieri soleat, calleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 37</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">callens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">acquainted with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">versed in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expert</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">qui sunt vaticinandi callentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utriusque linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 32</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">callenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">skilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunningly;</hi> for the class. callide, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 150, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calliblepharum: <entryFree id="n6274" type="main" key="calli^ble^pha^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callĭblĕphărum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">callĭblĕphărĭ-um</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kallible/faron</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">fa/rmakon</foreign>), <sense id="n6274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dye for coloring the eyebrows</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 218, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 19, 73, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:97" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 4, 51, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:102" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 6, 34, § 102</bibl>. —Hence, † <orth extent="full" lang="la">callĭblĕphărātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">with beautiful eyelids</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
callicia: <entryFree id="n6275" type="main" key="calli^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callĭcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant that</hi>, acc. to Pythagoras, <hi rend="ital">made water freeze</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 99, § 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callicias: <entryFree id="n6276" type="main" key="Calli^ci^a_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭcĭās</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callicles: <entryFree id="n6277" type="main" key="Calli^cle_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭclēs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a character in the</hi> Trinummus <hi rend="ital">of Plautus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6277.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Grecian painter in the time of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 114</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6277.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Grecian statuary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callicratidas: <entryFree id="n6278" type="main" key="Calli^cra^ti^das"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭcrătĭdas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kallikrati/das</foreign>, <sense id="n6278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Spartan general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">successor of Lysander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquered and slain near the Arginusœ.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 30, 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callicula: <entryFree id="n6279" type="main" key="Calli^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a low mountain in Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not far from Casilinum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 16, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callidamates: <entryFree id="n6280" type="main" key="Calli^da^ma^te_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭdămătēs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callide: <entryFree id="n6281" type="main" key="calli^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. callidus <sense id="n6281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
callidemides: <entryFree id="n6282" type="main" key="Calli^de_mi^de_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭdēmĭdēs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kallidhmi/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n6282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 3</bibl>. <cb n="CALL" /></sense></entryFree>
calliditas: <entryFree id="n6283" type="main" key="calli^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>callidus</etym>, <sense id="n6283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the being</hi> callidus, in a good or bad sense. </sense><sense id="n6283.1" n="I" level="1"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">shrewdness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">readiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aptness</hi> (so several times after the Aug. period): <cit><quote lang="la">calliditas ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:380" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 380</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 12, 74, § 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:15" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 9, 19</bibl>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n6283.2" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">craft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slyness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artfulness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia, quae est remota ab justitiā, calliditas potius quam sapientia est appellanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 32, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 39, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:126" default="NO">4, 2, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 300</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:50:2 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 50, 2 al.</bibl>—Of <hi rend="ital">stratagem in war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:47:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 47, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calliditas ad robur accesserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:4:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of oratorical artifice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus ejusmodi calliditatis atque calumniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:39:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 39, 137</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi venere in mentem Syri Calliditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 12, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callidromus: <entryFree id="n6284" type="main" key="Callidro^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callidrŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kalli/dromos</foreign>, <sense id="n6284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Locris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Thermopylœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part of the Œta range</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 15</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
callidulus: <entryFree id="n6285" type="hapax" key="calli^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n6285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [callidus], <hi rend="ital">a little cunning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 91</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
callidus: <entryFree id="n6286" type="main" key="calli^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>calleo</etym>, <sense id="n6286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is taught wisdom by experience and practice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrewd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">experienced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adroit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versutos eos appello, quorum celeriter mens versatur: callidos autem, quorum, tamquam manus opere, sic animus usu concalluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n6286.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ingenious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dexterous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilful.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6286.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.
