(class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad suum quaestum, callidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 62</bibl> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 40</bibl>: omnes homines ad suum quaestum callent); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 25</bibl>: callida Musa, Calliope, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego ut agitator callidus, priusquam ad fidem veniam, equos sustinebo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura nihil potest esse callidius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthene nec gravior exstitit quisquam nec callidior, nec temperatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis parum callidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in disputando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—In reference to art, <hi rend="ital">excelling in art</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilful</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 23</bibl> Heind.; 2, 7, 101; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 26</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6286.3" n="B" level="2"> Particular constructions. </sense><sense id="n6286.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei rusticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6286.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">juncturā callidus acri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:14" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6286.6" n="(g)" level="5"> In the Greek manner, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">callidus Condere furto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuque testudo resonare septem Callida nervis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:118" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 118</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6286.7" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of things: foramina callidissimo artificio naturā fabricata, <hi rend="ital">very well contrived</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wrought</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">junctura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6286.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Crafty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6286.9" n="A" level="2"> Of persons (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">itaque me malum esse oportet, callidum, astutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum crudumque et callidum atque subdolum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego hominem callidiorem vidi neminem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi saepe versutos homines et callidos admirantes, malitiam sapientiam judicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit> Beier; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 19, 55</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 13, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo luteus etiam callidus ac veterator esse vult,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:14:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens non astuta nec callida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fraudem callidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:65:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 65, 183</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in disputando mire callidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici accendendis offensionibus callidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6286.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">doli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:65:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 65, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">callida et malitiosa juris interpretatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitas,</quote> <trans><tr>crafty</tr>, <tr>calculating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malitia inimici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 44, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6286.11" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">merx, of a woman,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 61</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">callĭdē</orth> (in both signiff. of the <pos>adj.</pos> freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n6286.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Skilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrewdly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expertly</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">callide nosse aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>well</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">callide arguteque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">callide et perite versari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine quo nihil satis caute, nihil satis callide agi posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 5, 15 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6</bibl>, <pb n="271" /> <cb n="CALL" /> 37.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6286.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Cunningly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">craflily</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">callide et facete exordiri rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultare vitia sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">callide et cum astu confiteri aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
callifae: <entryFree id="n6287" type="main" key="Calli^fae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭfae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the region of the Hirpini</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Calvise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 25, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calligo: <entryFree id="n6288" type="main" key="calli_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callīgo</orth>, v. 1. caligo.</entryFree>
calligonon: <entryFree id="n6289" type="greek" key="calli^go^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callĭgŏnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kalli/gonon</foreign>, <sense id="n6289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> polygonon mas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 91, § 113</bibl> (v. Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
callimachus: <entryFree id="n6290" type="main" key="Calli^ma^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭmăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kalli/maxos</foreign>. <sense id="n6290.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A distinguished Greek poet and grammarian of Cyrene</hi> (hence Battiades; v. Battus, I. b.) <hi rend="ital">who lived in Alexandria in the reign of Ptolemy Philadelphus</hi>, B. C. 250, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 34, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 39, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 759</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:40" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:32" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 32</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭmăchīus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">metrum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a choriambic tetrameter and an amphibrach</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centim. p. 1823</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n6290.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6290.2" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 9, § 12</bibl>.!*? Apollas Callimachus, in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 14</bibl>, is yet unexplained; v. Spald. in h. l.</sense></entryFree>
callimus: <entryFree id="n6291" type="greek" key="calli^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callĭmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/llimos</foreign> (beautiful), <sense id="n6291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of eagle-stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 21, 39, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callinicus: <entryFree id="n6292" type="main" key="Calli^ni_cu^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭnīcŭs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kalli/neikos</foreign>, <sense id="n6292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callion: <entryFree id="n6293" type="greek" key="calli^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/llion</foreign>, <sense id="n6293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, called in pure Lat. vesicaria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 177</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callionymus: <entryFree id="n6294" type="greek" key="calli^o_ny^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callĭōnymus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kalliw/numos</foreign>, <sense id="n6294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> uranoscopus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 24, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calliope: <entryFree id="n6295" type="main" key="Calli^o^pe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭŏpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭŏpēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:80" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 80</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 563</bibl> P.), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kallio/ph</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*kallio/peia</foreign> (fine-voiced), <sense id="n6295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief of the Muses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goddess of Epic poetry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the poets</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sometimes of every other kind of poetry</hi> (e.g. <hi rend="ital">the lyric</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 1</bibl> sqq.; <hi rend="ital">of amatory poetry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:568" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 568</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of rural poetry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:225" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 225</bibl>; cf. Jahn, Trist. p. 198); <hi rend="ital">the mother of Orpheus by Œagrus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>; acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 5, 864</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">the mother of the Sirens by Acheloüs;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 94</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 339</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> I. p. 73, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:31:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 31, 8</bibl>. To her <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4</bibl>, is addressed.—</sense><sense id="n6295.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6295.2" n="A" level="2"> (Per syllepsin.) <hi rend="ital">All the Muses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 525</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6295.3" n="B" level="2"> (Per synecdochen.) <hi rend="ital">Poetry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:568" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 568</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭŏpēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kallioph/i+os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Calliope</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer, i. e. Hymenaeus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> VI. p. 89, 77</bibl></cit>: musici, Firm. Math. 7, 25.</sense></entryFree>
callipetalon: <entryFree id="n6296" type="main" key="calli^pe^ta^lon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callĭpĕtălon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kallipe/talon</foreign>, <sense id="n6296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, called in pure Lat. quinquefolium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callipho: <entryFree id="n6297" type="main" key="Calli^pho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭpho</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> -ōne, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 18</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a character in the Pseudolus of Plautus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 43</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
calliphon: <entryFree id="n6298" type="main" key="Calli^pho_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭphōn</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-pho</orth> in all pass. of Cic. acc. to Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 19</bibl>), ontis (<case>dat.</case> -ōni, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 8, 21</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> -ōnem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 33, 119</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kallifw=n, w=ntos</foreign>, <sense id="n6298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek philosopher who considered virtue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joined with pleasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as the highest good</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:30:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 30, 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 18, 50</bibl>; 5, 8, 21; 5, 25, 73; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epit. 33, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callipides: <entryFree id="n6299" type="main" key="Calli_pi^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callīpĭdes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Callipp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kallippidhs</foreign>, <sense id="n6299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Grecian runner who made no progress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem cursitare ac ne cubiti quidem mensuram progredi proverbio Graeco notatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callipolis: <entryFree id="n6300" type="main" key="Calli^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>acc.</case> -im or -in), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kalli/polis</foreign>. <sense id="n6300.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Grecian city of Calabria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Gallipoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6300.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town on the Thracian Chersonesus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite Lampsacus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Gallipoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 16, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6300.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town on the Tauric Chersonese</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 30, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callippus: <entryFree id="n6301" type="main" key="Callippu^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callippŭs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/llippos</foreign>, <sense id="n6301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callirrhoe: <entryFree id="n6302" type="main" key="Callirrho^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callirrhŏē</orth> (in poets, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Callĭrhŏē</orth>), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kallirro/h</foreign> (epic, <foreign lang="greek">*kalliro/h</foreign>). <sense id="n6302.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of the Acheloüs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and second wife of Alcmœon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:414 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 414 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6302.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Piranthus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Argus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Aristorides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Triopas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 145" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 145</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6302.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Oceanus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Chrysaor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Geryon</hi>, Hyg. praef. and Fab. 151. <cb n="CALL" /> —</sense><sense id="n6302.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated fountain at Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">south-east of the Acropolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:629" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 629</bibl>, with the appell. Enneacrunos (<foreign lang="greek">)*ennea/krounos</foreign>, i. e. conducted by <hi rend="ital">nine channels</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pipes</hi> into the city), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6302.4" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A warm medicinal fountain in Palestine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two hours west of Lake Asphaltites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 16, 15, § 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6302.5" n="VI" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another name of the Arabian city</hi> Edessa, <hi rend="ital">from a fountain of that name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 21, § 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callis: <entryFree id="n6303" type="main" key="callis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n6303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 42, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 15, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 10, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:11" default="NO">4, 16, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31, 10, 9</bibl>; cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, p. 673) [etym. dub.; acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 405</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 16, 10</bibl>, from callum; cf. Doed. Syn. IV. p. 68], <hi rend="ital">a stony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uneven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrow footway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a foot-path</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mountain-path</hi>, etc.; most freq., <hi rend="ital">a path made by the treading of cattle</hi>: callis est iter pecudum inter montes angustum et tritum, a callo pecudum perduratum, Isid. Orig. l. l.: callis = via pecorum vestigiis trita, Vet. Gloss. </sense><sense id="n6303.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">per calles silvestres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:10:1" default="NO">2, 10, 1</bibl> and 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 5, 12</bibl> Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">inde prope inviis callibus ad dictatorem perfugerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 15, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 405</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:626 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 626 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per calles ignotos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 42, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 27, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 15, 9</bibl>; 38, 2, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secreti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 443</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surgens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (3), 57.—</sense><sense id="n6303.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6303.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain-pasturage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declivity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mountain-pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi> (cf. Vogel ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 10, 10</bibl> <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">rara per occultos lucebat semita calles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 383</bibl></cit> Heyne: <cit><quote lang="la">nos hic pecorum modo per aestivos saltus deviasque callis exercitum ducimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per calles saltusque Macedonicorum montium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 36, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Ciliciae angustiis et inviis callibus dimicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustis in Ciliciae callibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:4" default="NO">5, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:17" default="NO">5, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 30, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestor, cui provincia vetere ex more calles evenerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 27</bibl></cit> Orell. and Draeg. ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(provincia) semitae callesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calles consitae arboribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 10, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6303.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">path</hi>, <hi rend="ital">road</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:568" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 568</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:394" default="NO">5, 394</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 92</bibl>, the correct read. is calcis, not callis; v. Lachm. ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
callisco: <entryFree id="n6304" type="hapax" key="callisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n6304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [calleo], <hi rend="ital">to become dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensible</hi>: aures nobis calliscerunt ad injurias, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 89, 27 sq.</bibl> (Meyer, calliscunt, Or. Rom. Fragm. p. 118).</sense></entryFree>
callisthenes: <entryFree id="n6305" type="main" key="Callisthe^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callisthĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kallisqe/nhs</foreign>, <sense id="n6305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a philosopher of Olynthus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s son and pupil of Aristotle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and a youthful friend of Alexander the Great; finally put to death by him for his freedom of speech</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5, 13</bibl> sqq.; 8, 6, 25; 8, 8, 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 23</bibl>. Theophrastus bewailed his death in the work entitled <foreign lang="greek">*kallisqe/nhs h)\ peri\ pe/nqous</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:10:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9, 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:23:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 23, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callisto: <entryFree id="n6306" type="main" key="Callisto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callisto</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (ōnis, Serv. ad. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 67</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kallistw/</foreign>, <sense id="n6306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of the Arcadian king Lycaon</hi> (hence, Lycaonis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:173" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo Tegeaea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maenalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:192" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo Nonacrina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 409</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">and mother of Arcas by Jupiter; changed by Juno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of jealousy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into a she-bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and then raised to the heavens by Jupiter in the form of the constellation</hi> Helice or Ursa Major, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 176" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:177" default="NO">177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 28, 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:156 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 156 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:401 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 401 sq.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Callisto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> Callisto Lycaonidi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 66</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> Callisto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 155" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callistratus: <entryFree id="n6307" type="main" key="Callistra^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callistrătus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kalli/stratos</foreign>. <sense id="n6307.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Grecian orator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 6, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6307.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Grecian statuary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 52</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6307.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Grecian writer on natural history</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 3, 12, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:94" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 7, 25, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callistruthia: <entryFree id="n6308" type="greek" key="callistru_thi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callistrūthĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">callistrūthis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:416" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 416</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> (sc. ficus), = <foreign lang="greek">kallistrou/qia</foreign>, <sense id="n6308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very delicate kind of figs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which sparrows were fond of</hi> [Gr. <foreign lang="greek">strouqo/s</foreign>], <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 69</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">pure Lat. ficus passerariae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Albin. 11, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
callithrix: <entryFree id="n6309" type="greek" key="callithrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callithrix</orth>, <itype>trĭchos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kalli/qric</foreign> (fair-haired). <sense id="n6309.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant used for coloring the hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> trichomanes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 15, 90, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:147" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 14, 87, § 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:135" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 11, 86, § 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6309.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">callitrĭches</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of ape</hi> or <hi rend="ital">monkey in Ethiopia;</hi> acc. to Lichtenstein, Simia faunus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 54, 80, § 216</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callitrichos: <entryFree id="n6310" type="greek" key="calli^tri^cho^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callĭtrĭchŏs</orth>, i. <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kalli/trixos</foreign> <cb n="CALO" /> (fair-haired), <sense id="n6310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commonly called</hi> adiantum or Capillus Veneris, <hi rend="ital">maidenhair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 30, § 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callon: <entryFree id="n6311" type="main" key="Callon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Callon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/llwn</foreign>. <sense id="n6311.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A statuary of Ægina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Callones,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>people like Callon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6311.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A statuary of Elis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who flourished about</hi> 430 B. C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
callositas: <entryFree id="n6312" type="main" key="callo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>callosus</etym>, <sense id="n6312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hardness of skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">callousness</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 36" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 27, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hardness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hardening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus communis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Testim. Anim. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntarii erroris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Nat. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
callosus: <entryFree id="n6313" type="main" key="callo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>callum</etym>, <sense id="n6313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with a hard skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard-skinned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thick-skinned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">callous</hi> (not before the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">ulcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 14, 87, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 79, § 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crassior callosiorque cutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 92, § 226</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6313.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">solid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thick</hi>: ova, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acini uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Sept. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae (ulceris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
callum: <entryFree id="n6314" type="main" key="callum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">callum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">callus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:31 al" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26, 31 al.</bibl>; Domit. Mars. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 55</bibl>; <number>plur.</number> calli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 37" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:205" default="NO">205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 80</bibl>) [cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kala/mh</foreign>; Lat. culmus, culmen]. <sense id="n6314.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The hardened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thick skin upon animal bodies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fere res omnes aut corio sunt Aut etiam conchis aut callo aut cortice tectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:935" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 935</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceamentum solorum callum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 60, § 127</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 108</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 80</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6314.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6314.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The hard flesh of certain animals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aprugnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 4</bibl>; for which <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> callum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus elephanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 10, 10, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locustarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 30, 50, § 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6314.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The hard skin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the hard flesh of plants</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pirorum ac malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 28, 34, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fungorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 23, 47, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 22, 34, § 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 28 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6314.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The hard covering of the soil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 5, 3, § 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:33" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 2, 11, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:53" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 4, 30, § 53</bibl>; also, <hi rend="ital">of the hardness of salt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 12, 23, § 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6314.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hardness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">callousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupidity</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Cic.): ipse labor quasi callum quoddam obducit dolori,</quote> <trans><tr>renders callous to pain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 15, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 22, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
calo: <entryFree id="n6315" type="greek" key="ca^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călo</orth> (as a very ancient word, with its derivatives also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">kălo</orth>; <sense id="n6315.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">K</ref></xr>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kalw=</foreign>; Engl. call</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to call</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convoke;</hi> only as t. t. in reference to religious matters; v. Kalendae, and the ancient formulary in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 27</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 15</bibl>: calata comitia, <hi rend="ital">a kind of comitia held for the purpose of consecrating a priest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a king.</hi> Of these, some were curiata, others centuriata, Laelius Felix ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 27 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calata in Capitolium plebe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 33</bibl>.—Hence, sarcastically, on account of bribery, calatis granis (instead of comitiis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 33, 72</bibl> Orell.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6316" type="main" key="ca_lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cālo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ka=lon</foreign>, timber for burning or joiner's work; <foreign lang="greek">kai/w</foreign>, to burn</etym>, <sense id="n6316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a servant in the army</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a soldier</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s servant</hi>: calones militum servi dicti, qui ligneas clavas gerebant, quae Graece <foreign lang="greek">ka=la</foreign> vocant, Paul. ex Fest. pp. 46 and 62 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 62, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 6</bibl>; Dict. of Antiq.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 20</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 3, 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 20</bibl>.—On account of their stupidity: <cit><quote lang="la">sambucam citius caloni aptaveris alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:95" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6316.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6316.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Any low servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drudge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 110:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 110, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6316.3" n="B" level="2"> Acc. to Isidorus, some called <hi rend="ital">the tragic buskins</hi> calones, because they were made of willow, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 34, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calocissus: <entryFree id="n6317" type="main" key="Ca^lo^cissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Călŏcissus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">kalo/s, kisso/s</foreign>, = beautiful ivy</etym>, <sense id="n6317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a cup-bearer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:93:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 93, 3</bibl> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>
calor: <entryFree id="n6318" type="main" key="ca^lor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>caleo; cf. Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 46, 22</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n6318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">warmth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glow.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6318.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6318.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very freq. in prose and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): neque mihi ulla obsistet amnis nec calor; <cit><quote lang="la">nec frigus metuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; so (opp. frigus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 517</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:371" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 371</bibl>; Cic. N. D. <pb n="272" /> <cb n="CALP" /> 2, 39, 101; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 344</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 36</bibl>; (opp. refrigeratio) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calor ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 571</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:514" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 514</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 234</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:37 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 37 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6318.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n6318.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Vital heat;</hi> so, vitalis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnia quae aluntur atque crescunt, contineant in se vim caloris, sine quā neque ali possent neque crescere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis et una Dilapsus calor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 705</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6318.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Summer heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the warmth of summer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitandi caloris causā Lanuvii tres horas acquieveram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 34 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:62:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 62, 265</bibl>.—Hence also for <hi rend="ital">summer</hi> (opp. ver and autumnus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:48" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediis caloribus,</quote> <trans><tr>in the midst of summer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; so <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tectis saepti frigora caloresque pellamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:152" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 152</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6318.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The glow of a hot wind</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 323</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis venti commixta calore): dum ficus prima calorque, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>the burning heat of the parching Sirocco</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calores austrini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 270</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">calidi Austri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 532</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n6318.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The heat of a fever</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:11:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 11, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6318.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6318.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the heat of passion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">zeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuosity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemence</hi> (so perh. not before the Aug. per.; esp. freq. in Quint.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor, fervor): si calor ac spiritus tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Polus juvenili calore inconsideratior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calor cogitationis, qui scribendi morā refrixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 113</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calorem cogitationis exstinguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">27: et impetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenis caloris alieni derisus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 19, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitionis calor abducit a tutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:14:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod calore aliquo gerendum est, id. Ira, 3, 3, 5: cohortationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:17:48" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 17, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 324</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n6318.10" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">ardent love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fire of love</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahere calorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 305</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 19, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:223" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 223</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number> (cf. amores), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 237</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6319" type="main" key="Ca^lo^r2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Călŏr</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Samnium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Calore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 17, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caloratus: <entryFree id="n6320" type="main" key="ca^lo_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>calor</etym> (postclass. and rare). <sense id="n6320.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 20, 16, 7</bibl></cit> (al. coloratum): Calabria, Porphyr. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:27" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies caloratissimi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Hor. S. 1, 6, 126</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6320.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventutis impetus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 182, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
calorificus: <entryFree id="n6321" type="hapax" key="ca^lo_ri^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călōrĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>calor-facio</etym>, <sense id="n6321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">causing warmth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum calorificum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
calpar: <entryFree id="n6322" type="gloss" key="calpar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calpar</orth>, <itype>aris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ka/lph = ka/lpis</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n6322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel for liquids</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">for wine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a winecask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wine-pitcher</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 546, 32 sq.</bibl>: calpar genus vasis fictilis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=46" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 46</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n6322.1" n="II" level="1"> Calpar = vinum novum, quod ex dolio demitur sacrificii causā, antequam gustetur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=65" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 65</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
calpe: <entryFree id="n6323" type="main" key="Calpe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Calpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/lph</foreign>, <sense id="n6323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the pillars of Hercules in</hi> Hispania Baetica, now <hi rend="ital">Rock of Gibraltar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:8" default="NO">2, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3</bibl>, prooem. § 4; 3, 1, 3, § 7; Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ibera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1254" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1254</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 555</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 71</bibl> (<case>abl.</case> scanned Calpĕ, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:279" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 279</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n6323.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n6323.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Calpētā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Calpe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Progn. 1620</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6323.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Calpētĭtānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Calpe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 1023</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
calpurnius: <entryFree id="n6324" type="main" key="Calpurni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Calpurnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>a Calpo Numae regis filio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=36" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 36</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n6324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of the very distinguished Calpurnian</hi> gens: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:23:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 23, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6324.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6324.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6324.3" n="1" level="3"> C. Calpurnius Piso, <hi rend="ital">prœtor</hi> B.C. 186, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 30, 1</bibl> sqq.; and <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> B.C. 180, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 37, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6324.4" n="2" level="3"> L. Calpurnius Piso, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> B.C. 112, <hi rend="ital">and afterwards</hi>, B.C. 107, <hi rend="ital">lieutenant of Cassius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6324.5" n="3" level="3"> L. Calpurnius Bestia, <hi rend="ital">tribune of the people</hi> B.C. 121, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> B.C. 111, <hi rend="ital">and a general against Jugurtha</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 34, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 27</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n6324.6" n="4" level="3"> C. Calpurnius Piso, <hi rend="ital">son-in-law of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:24:54 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 24, 54 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6324.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The intimate friend of Antonius</hi>, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8</bibl> A, 2.— </sense><sense id="n6324.8" n="6" level="3"> L. Calpurnius Piso Frugi, <hi rend="ital">consul with</hi> P. Mucius Scaevola, A.U.C. 621, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:27:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 27, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:8:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:11 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 11 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6324.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6324.10" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cal-purnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the wife of Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:57" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 57</bibl>, <cb n="CALU" /> 2.—</sense><sense id="n6324.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Antistius and daughter of</hi> Bestia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:26" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6324.12" n="III" level="1"> Calpurnia lex. </sense><sense id="n6324.13" n="a" level="4"> De pecuniis repetundis, <hi rend="ital">introduced by the tribune of the people</hi>, L. Calpurnius Piso Frugi, A.U.C. 605, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:84:section=195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 84, § 195</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 25, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:27:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 27, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 21, 75</bibl> Beier.—</sense><sense id="n6324.14" n="b" level="4"> De ambitu, <hi rend="ital">by the consul</hi> C. Calpurnius Piso, A.U.C. 687, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:23:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 23, 46</bibl>; Corn. Fragm. Ascon. (v. 2, p. 68 Orell.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 20</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6324.15" n="c" level="4"> Militaris, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 107, 16</bibl>.— Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Calpurnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a Calpurnius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites,</quote> <trans><tr>serving under the prœtor Calpurnius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 31, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caltha: <entryFree id="n6325" type="main" key="caltha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">caltha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">calthum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 5, 114</bibl>) [cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xa/lkanqos</foreign>], <sense id="n6325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strongsmelling yellow flower</hi>, prob. our <hi rend="ital">pot marigold</hi>: Calendula officinalis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 15, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:97" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:310" default="NO">10, 310</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calthula: <entryFree id="n6326" type="hapax" key="calthu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calthŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>caltha, from its color; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 548, 21</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n6326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a yellow garment for women</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a yellow robe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calumma: <entryFree id="n6327" type="greek" key="ca^lumma^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călummă</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">călymm-</orth>), <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/lumma</foreign>, <sense id="n6327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calumnia: <entryFree id="n6328" type="main" key="ca^lumni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călumnĭa</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">kălumnĭa</orth>; <sense id="n6328.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">K</ref></xr>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. for calvomnia, from calvor; cf. incīlo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">trickery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chicanery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning device.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6328.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6328.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">per obtrectatores Lentuli calumniā extracta res est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Lucullus) inimicorum calumniā triennio tardius quam debuerat triumphavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inpediti ne triumpharent calumniā paucorum, quibus omnia honesta atque inhonesta vendere mos erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metellus calumniā dicendi tempus exemit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omni morā, ludificatione, calumniā senatūs auctoritas impediretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:35:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 35, 75</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ab adversariis nostris extracta est variis calumniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6328.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n6328.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pretence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subterfuge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris judicium cum erit et aequitatis, cave in istā tam frigidā, tam jejunā calumniā delitescas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 21, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus religionis calumniam non religione, sed malevolentiā ... comprobat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carneades ... itaque premebat alio modo nec ullam adhibebat calumniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:14:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniam stultitiamque ejus obtrivit ac contudit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud in primis, ne qua calumnia, ne qua fraus, ne quis dolus adhibeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae major calumnia est, quam venire imberbum adulescentulum... dicere se filium senatorem sibi velle adoptare?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6328.5" n="2" level="3"> In discourse, etc., <hi rend="ital">a misrepresentation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">false statement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fallacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cavil</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cavillatio, perfugium): haec cum uberius disputantur et fusius, facilius effugiunt Academicorum calumniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Carneades) saepe optimas causas ingenii calumniā ludificari solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Arcesilae calumnia conferenda est cum Democriti verecundiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in minimis rebus pertinacia reprehenditur, calumnia etiam coërcetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altera est calumnia, nullam artem falsis adsentiri opinionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis tamen... ad necessaria aliquid melius adjecerit, non erit hac calumniā reprendendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6328.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A false accusation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">malicious charge</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a false</hi> or <hi rend="ital">malicious information</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">action at law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a perversion of justice</hi> ( = <foreign lang="greek">sukofanti/a</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">jam de deorum inmortalium templis spoliatis qualem calumniam ad pontifices adtulerit?</quote> <trans><tr>false report</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythae ... cum confecto jam bello supervenissent, et calumniā tardius lati auxilii, mercede fraudarentur,</quote> <trans><tr>an unjust charge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam illa fuit ad calumniam singulari consilio reperta ratio... Quae res cum ad pactiones iniquissimas magnam vim habuit, tum vero ad calumnias in quas omnes inciderent, quos vellent Apronius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:15:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam calumniae reperire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">21: (Heraclius), a quo HS. C. milia per calumniam malitiamque petita sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">66: mirari improbitatem calumniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">37: exsistunt etiam saepe injuriae calumniā quādam et nimis callidā juris interpretatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste amplam occasionem calumniae nactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:25:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 25, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem iste in decumis, in rebus capitalibus, in omni calumniā praecursorem habere solebat et emissarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 41</bibl></cit>, § 108; <cb n="CALU" /> 2, 2, 9, § <cit><quote lang="la">25: ad rapinas convertit animum, vario et exquisitissimo calumniarum et auctionum et vectigalium genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 38 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>;
