cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the context: calumniā litium alienos fundos petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo illis odium Romanorum incussit rapacitas proconsulum, sectio publicanorum, calumniae litium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:7:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniarum metum inicere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes confiscatos ob tam leve ac tam inpudens calumniarum genus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniis rapinisque intendit animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creditorum turbam... nonnisi terrore calumniarum amovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiscales calumnias magna calumniantium repressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istae calumniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 1, p. 273, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">calumnia magiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 274, 10.—</sense><sense id="n6328.7" n="4" level="3"> Hence, jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">the bringing of an action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whether civil</hi> or <hi rend="ital">criminal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in bad faith</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actoris calumnia quoque coërcetur,</quote> <trans><tr>litigiousness on the part of the plaintiff</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:16:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 16, 1</bibl></cit> Sandars ad loc.; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 174</bibl>: vetus calumniae actio, <hi rend="ital">a prosecution for blackmail</hi> or <hi rend="ital">malicious prosecution</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl>: calumniam jurare, <hi rend="ital">to take the oath that the action is brought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defence offered in good faith</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 3</bibl>: sei juraverit calumniae causā non postulare, Lex Acil. Repetund. 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 7</bibl>; cf.: praeter jusjurandum exigere non calumniae causā infitias ire, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 172</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jusjurandum exigere non calumniae causā agere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 176</bibl></cit>.—Hence: <cit><quote lang="la">nec satis habere bello vicisse Hannibalem, nisi velut accusatores calumniam in eum jurarent ac nomen deferrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 37, 5</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de calumniā jurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:13:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 13, § 3</bibl></cit>: jusjurandum de calumniā, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:3:34 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 3, 34 al.</bibl>: et quidem calumniae judicium adversus omnes actiones locum habet, <hi rend="ital">a conviction in a cross-action for malicious prosecution</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 175</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpissimam personam calumniae honestae civitati inponere,</quote> <trans><tr>to fasten the vile character of a malicious prosecutor upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17:section=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ignominiā calumniae accusationem relinquere non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 31, 86</bibl></cit>.— The person convicted of this charge was branded on the forehead with the letter K; v. calumniator.—</sense><sense id="n6328.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a conviction for malicious prosecution</hi> ( = calumniae judicium, v. I. A. 4. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">hic illo privato judicio, mihi credite, calumniam non effugiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 59, 163</bibl></cit>: scito C. Sempronium Rufum, mel ac delicias tuas, calumniam maximo plausu tulisse, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusare alienae dominationis scelerisque socius propter calumniae metum non est ausus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:19:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perinde poenā teneri ac si publico judicio calumniae condemnatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniam fictis eludere jocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, prol. 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6328.9" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6328.10" n="A" level="2"> Of abstr. things: in hac igitur calumniā timoris et caecae suspitionis tormento, cum plurima ad alieni sensūs conjecturam, non ad suum judicium scribantur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">when the writer</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s mind is made the fool of his fears</hi>, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6328.11" n="B" level="2"> Contra se, <hi rend="ital">a mistaken severity towards one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inveni qui Ciceroni crederent, eum (Calvum) nimiā contra se calumniā verum sanguinem perdidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:115" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 115</bibl></cit> (referring to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:283" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 82, 283</bibl>: nimium inquirens in se atque ipse sese observans, metuensque ne vitiosum colligeret, etiam verum sanguinem deperdebat).</sense></entryFree>
calumniator: <entryFree id="n6329" type="main" key="ca^lumni^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călumnĭātor</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">kălumnĭātor</orth>; v. the foreg.), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>calumnior</etym>; mostly t. t., <sense id="n6329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contriver of tricks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">artifices</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pettifogger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a perverter of law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chicaner</hi> (sometimes, perhaps, branded on the forehead with the letter K = calumniator; cf. Voss, Arist. 1, 17; <cit><quote lang="la">Ernest. Clav. Cic. Ind. Leg. s. v. Remmia): si calvitur et moretur et frustratur. Inde et calumniatores appellati sunt, quia per fraudem et frustrationem alios vexarent litibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:223" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptum sequi calumniatoris esse: boni judicis, voluntatem scriptoris auctoritatemque defendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Caecil. 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniatores apponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniatorem quaerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>, § 22; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 2, 10, § 26: egens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 59, 163</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 28, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:66:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 66, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:4:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 4, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6329.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniator sui,</quote> <trans><tr>one who is too anxious in regard to his work</tr>, <tr>over-scrupulous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 92</bibl></cit>; cf. calumnia, III. B., and calumnior, II. B. <pb n="273" /> <cb n="CALV" /></sense></entryFree>
calumniatrix: <entryFree id="n6330" type="main" key="ca^lumni^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călumnĭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>calumniator</etym>, <sense id="n6330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who plots against</hi> or <hi rend="ital">makes false accusations</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 74, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:9:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 9, 1</bibl>, §§ 14 and 16.</sense></entryFree>
calumnior: <entryFree id="n6331" type="main" key="ca^lumni^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călumnĭor</orth> (anciently <orth extent="full" lang="la">kăl-</orth>; <sense id="n6331.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">K</ref></xr>), ātus, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. act.</hi> [calumnia]. </sense><sense id="n6331.1" n="I" level="1"> Jurid. t. t. </sense><sense id="n6331.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To accuse falsely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring false information</hi> against a person. </sense><sense id="n6331.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniari est falsa crimina intendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:16:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 16, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ib. prooem.: ut hic quoque Apronio... ex miseris aratoribus calumniandi quaestus accederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:15:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquid habeat quod possit criminose ac suspitiose dicere, aperte ludificari et calumniari sciens non videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (defensor) accusatorem calumniari criminatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum Romam accusator Eumenes venerat, qui calumniando omnia detorquendoque suspecta et invisa efficeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 42, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae veterum aerari debitorum, vel praecipua calumniandi materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna calumniantium poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus objectus calumniantibus foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniatur accusator actione sacrilegii, cum privata fuerit (pecunia sublata) non sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an petitorem calumniari, an reum infitiatorem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6331.4" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tamen alio crimine postuletur ab eodem, qui in alio crimine eum calumniatus est, puto non facile admittendum eum qui semel calumniatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:2:7:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 2, 7, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed non utique qui non probat quod intendit calumniari videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:16:1:section=3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 16, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6331.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To practise chicanery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trickery</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">subterfuge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacet res in controversiis isto calumniante biennium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 21, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meque, etiam si diutius calumniarentur. redire jussistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 11, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6331.6" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to depreciate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misrepresent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calumniate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blame unjustly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6331.7" n="A" level="2"> With personal object: <cit><quote lang="la">nam, quod antea te calumniatus sum, indicabo malitiam meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi calumniari naturam rerum homines quam sibi prodesse mallent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis tamen eum verbis calumniatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl></cit> (7), 3, 23.—With <case>dat.</case> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">non solum filio sed etiam patri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Inc. Dom. Sacr. 8, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6331.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp., with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to depreciate one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be unduly anxious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">careful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibusdam tamen nullus est finis calumniandi se, et... qui etiam, cum optima sunt reperta, quaerunt aliquid, quod sit magis antiquum, remotum, inopinatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, proocm. § <cit><quote lang="la">31: neque eos... ad infelicem calumniandi se poenam alligandos puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6331.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: sed calumniabar ipse; <cit><quote lang="la">putabam, qui obviam mihi venisset, suspicaturum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>indulged unreasonable fears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. A. 2. supra.—</sense><sense id="n6331.10" n="C" level="2"> With things as objects, <hi rend="ital">to misrepresent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpret injuriously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set in a false light</hi>: non calumniatur verba nec voltus; <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid accidit, benigne interpretando levat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 81:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 81, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitionibus inquietantur medicisque jam sani manum porrigunt et omnem calorem corporis sui calumniantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tranq. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festinationem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus civile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:4:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
calumniose: <entryFree id="n6332" type="main" key="ca^lumni^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călumnĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. calumniosus <sense id="n6332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
calumniosus: <entryFree id="n6333" type="main" key="ca^lumni^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călumnĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>calumnia</etym>, <sense id="n6333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of tricks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">artifices</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swindling</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">calumniosus est, qui sciens prudensque per fraudem negotium alicui comparat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:2:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 152" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 152 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6333.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">că-lumnĭōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a person convicted of false information</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:16:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 16, 3</bibl>; cf. calumnia, I. B. 4.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">călumnĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">artfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by trickery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:5:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 48" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 48</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:76" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calva: <entryFree id="n6334" type="main" key="calva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. calvus.</entryFree>
calvaria: <entryFree id="n6335" type="main" key="calva_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calvārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>calva, calvus</etym>. <sense id="n6335.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The skull</hi> of man, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 9, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calvariae locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:27:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 27, 33</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of beasts: canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 6, 18, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equae, asinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6335.1" n="II" level="1"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">Calvary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the place where Jesus Christ was crucified</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 198</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calvariola: <entryFree id="n6336" type="main" key="calva_ri^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calvārĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>calvaria</etym>, <sense id="n6336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small cup</hi>, Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:48" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calvarium: <entryFree id="n6337" type="main" key="calva_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calvārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of round sea-fish without scales</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calvatus: <entryFree id="n6338" type="main" key="calva_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calvātus</orth>, a. <itype>um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>calvus</etym>, <sense id="n6338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made bald</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bare</hi> (late Lat.): Sampson, Ambros. <cb n="CALX" /> Ep. 9, 71.—</sense><sense id="n6338.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: si vinea a vite calvata erit, Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 196</bibl> Jan. (but <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 3</bibl>, calva erit; v. calvus).</sense></entryFree>
calvena: <entryFree id="n6339" type="main" key="Calve_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Calvēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>calvus</etym>, <sense id="n6339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nickname of the bald-headed Matius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 11, 1</bibl> (so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 2, 2</bibl>, the name Madarus = <foreign lang="greek">madaro/s</foreign>, bald).</sense></entryFree>
calveo: <entryFree id="n6340" type="hapax" key="calve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calvĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be bald</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 47, § 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calvesco: <entryFree id="n6341" type="main" key="calvesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calvesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n6341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [calveo], <hi rend="ital">to become bald</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 41, § 78</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6341.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to plants, <hi rend="ital">to grow up thin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">far apart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 33, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calvina: <entryFree id="n6342" type="main" key="Calvi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Calvīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a notorious woman of rank</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:133" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calvinus: <entryFree id="n6343" type="main" key="Calvi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Calvīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen;</hi> esp., </sense><sense id="n6343.1" n="I" level="1"> Cn. Domitius Calvinus, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi>, A.U.C. 701, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11</bibl> (13), 2; 2, 3, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:12:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 12, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6343.2" n="II" level="1"> C. Sextius Calvinus, <hi rend="ital">an eminent advocate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 34, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 246</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calvio: <entryFree id="n6344" type="main" key="calvio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calvio</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. calvor.</entryFree>
calvisius: <entryFree id="n6345" type="main" key="Calvi^si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Calvĭsĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several Romans;</hi> esp., </sense><sense id="n6345.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Calvisius Sabinus, <hi rend="ital">lieutenant of Cæsar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and afterwards prœtor in Africa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:34 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 34 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 10, 26</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6345.2" n="II" level="1"> Calvisius Sabinus, <hi rend="ital">a very rich man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 27:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 27, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 21</bibl>; perh. the same with Calvisius, <hi rend="ital">the accuser of Agrippina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Nero</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s mother</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 19</bibl> sqq.—Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Calvĭsĭ-ānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Calvisius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:5:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:5:5" default="NO">38, 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calvities: <entryFree id="n6346" type="main" key="calvi^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calvĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>calvus</etym>, <sense id="n6346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">baldness</hi> (a rare form for calvitium): prae calvitie, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 108, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calvitium: <entryFree id="n6347" type="main" key="calvi^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calvĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">baldness</hi> (class.; access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">calvĭtĭes</orth>). </sense><sense id="n6347.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: in luctu capillum sibi evellere, quasi calvitio maeror levaretur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 47, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 72, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Nat. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> —</sense><sense id="n6347.2" n="II" level="1"> Of places destitute of herbage, <hi rend="ital">bareness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sterility</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calvor: <entryFree id="n6348" type="main" key="calvor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calvor</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n6348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cal-vo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">calvio</orth>, <itype>Are</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 720</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n6348.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To devise tricks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use artifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack one with artifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to intrigue against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deceive</hi> (except in Sallust, only ante-class. for the class. calumnior): SI. CALVITVR. PEDEMVE. STRVIT., Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. Fest. s. v. struere, p. 313 Müll.; the same law is fragmentarily mentioned by Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 7, 2</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:233" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 233</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6348.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delude</hi>: me calvitur suspitio, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 7, 6</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 137 Rib.): calamitas arvas calvitur, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 192, 32</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 396 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 2, 4</bibl>: sed memet calvor, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 6, 33</bibl>.!*? <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> (cf. calumnior <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): te vocis calvi similitudine, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 6, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 78</bibl> Dietsch, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 883</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
calvus: <entryFree id="n6349" type="main" key="calvus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. O. H. Germ. chalo; Germ. kahl</etym>, <sense id="n6349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bald</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without hair</hi> (whether by nature or by shaving or shearing; rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Lucr., Cic., Hor., or Verg.): raso capite calvus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moechus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 6, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6349.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">calva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the scalp without hair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:24:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 24, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:83:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 83, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:45:12" default="NO">12, 45, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6349.2" n="B" level="2"> Venus Calva, <hi rend="ital">worshipped in a particular temple after the irruption of the Gauls</hi> (as it is pretended, because at that time the women cut off their hair for bowstrings), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Idol. Van. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 720</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6349.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to plants: <cit><quote lang="la">vinea a vite calva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 196</bibl>, s. v. calvatus): <cit><quote lang="la">nuces,</quote> <trans><tr>with smooth shells</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8, 2</bibl></cit> (quoted in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 90</bibl>, where in MSS. the var. lect. galbas prob. arose from a false orthography of a later time; cf. the letter B <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">calvae restes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 32, 20</bibl></cit>.—Also, </sense><sense id="n6349.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">calva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a nut with a smooth shell</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 66, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6350" type="main" key="Calvus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Calvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cognomen of several persons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially of the poet and orator C. Licinius;</hi> v. Licinius.</sense></entryFree>
calx: <entryFree id="n6351" type="main" key="calx1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calx</orth>, <itype>calcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:105" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 105</bibl> dub.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:696" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 696</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 483</bibl> Oud.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:105" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 105</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 278</bibl>. Whether Lucil. ap. <cb n="CALY" /> Charis, p. 72 P. belongs here or to 2. calx is undecided) [Sanscr. kar-, wound, kill; akin with <foreign lang="greek">la/c</foreign>, calcar, calceus], <sense id="n6351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the heel.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6351.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">calces deteris,</quote> <trans><tr>you tread on my heels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si ipsa animi vis In capite aut umeris aut imis calcibus esse Posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 792</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:136" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 136</bibl>: incursare pug nis, calcibus, <foreign lang="greek">pu\c kai\ la/c</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certare pugnis, calcibus, unguibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti pugnis et calcibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:25:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 25, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concisus pugnis et calcibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:23:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 23, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsellium calce premere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 55, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferire pugno vel calce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedemque citum ferratā (al. ferrato) calce fatigat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 714</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudā calce vexare ilia equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:115" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:697" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 697</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:169" default="NO">13, 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:541" default="NO">17, 541</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudis calcibus anguem premere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:43" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—Also of the heels of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupes calcibus auras Verberat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:892" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 892</bibl></cit>.—Hence, caedere calcibus, <hi rend="ital">to kick</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">laktizw</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calce petere aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to kick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:755" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extundere frontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 21, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calces remittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to kick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">reicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut dic aut accipe calcem,</quote> <trans><tr>take a kick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:295 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 295 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n6351.2" n="2" level="3"> Prov.: adversus stimulum calces (sc. jactare, etc.) = <foreign lang="greek">lakti/zein pro\s ke/ntron</foreign> (Aesch Agam. 1624; Pind. Pyth. 2, 174; <cit><quote lang="la">W. T. Act. 9, 5),</quote> <trans><tr>to kick against the pricks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit> Don. and Ruhnk.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 55</bibl>, and s. v. calcitro: calcem impingere alicui rei, <hi rend="ital">to abandon any occupation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anglice,</quote> <trans><tr>to hang a thing on the nail</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6351.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (pars pro toto), <hi rend="ital">the foot</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">calcemque terit jam calce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 324</bibl></cit> Serv. and Heyne. —</sense><sense id="n6351.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to similar things. </sense><sense id="n6351.5" n="A" level="2"> In architecture: calces scaporum, <hi rend="ital">the foot of the pillars of a staircase;</hi> Fr. patin de l'échiffre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9</bibl>, praef. § 8.—</sense><sense id="n6351.6" n="B" level="2"> Calx mali, <hi rend="ital">the foot of the mast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6351.7" n="C" level="2"> In agriculture, <hi rend="ital">the piece of wood cut off with a scion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6352" type="main" key="calx2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">calx</orth>, <itype>calcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 199, 24</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 86</bibl>; dub. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 8, 15</bibl>; and id. Rep. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. Rudd. I. p. 37, n. 3; later collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">calcis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Ven. Fort. Carm. 11, 11, 10) [<foreign lang="greek">xa/lic</foreign>]. <sense id="n6352.0" n="I" level="1"> Liv. </sense><sense id="n6352.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small stone used in gaming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a counter</hi> (less freq. than the <lbl>dim.</lbl> calculus, q. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 86</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 687</bibl> P.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=46" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 46</bibl> Müll.— </sense><sense id="n6352.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Limestone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lime</hi>, whether slaked or not, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1067" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1067</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viva,</quote> <trans><tr>unslaked</tr>, <tr>quicklime</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coquere,</quote> <trans><tr>to burn lime</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl>: exstincta, <hi rend="ital">slaked</hi>, id. l. l.: <cit><quote lang="la">macerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 55, § 177</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenatus,</quote> <trans><tr>mixed with sand</tr>, <tr>mortar</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materies ex calce et harenā mixta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>.— Since the goal or limit in the race-ground was designated by lime (as later by chalk, v. creta), calx signifies, </sense><sense id="n6352.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the goal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">limit in the race-course</hi> (anciently marked with lime or chalk; opp. carceres, the starting-point; mostly ante-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Cic.): supremae calcis spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 92</bibl></cit> Lachm.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:32" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 32</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 199, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad calcem pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 101</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad carceres a calce revocari,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to turn back from the end to the beginning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc video calcem, ad quam (al. quem) cum sit decursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: ab ipsā (al. ipso) calce revocati, id. Rep. Fragm. ap. Sen. l.l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 30</bibl> dub.; v. Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n6352.4" n="b" level="4"> Prov., of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">extra calcem decurrere,</quote> <trans><tr>to digress from a theme</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6352.5" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclusion</hi> of a page, book, or writing (mostly post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si tamen in clausulā et calce pronuntietur sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in calce epistulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">26</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 84 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: in calce libri, id. Vit. St. Hil. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
calycadnus: <entryFree id="n6353" type="main" key="Ca^ly^cadnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Călycadnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river and promontory of Cilicia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 38, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calyculus: <entryFree id="n6354" type="main" key="ca^ly^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călycŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>calyx</etym>, <sense id="n6354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small flower-bud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the cup</hi> or <hi rend="ital">calyx of a flower</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 19, 78, § 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 5, 20, § 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 143, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6354.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the outer skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi> of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">echinorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 35, p. 297, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
calydon: <entryFree id="n6355" type="main" key="Ca^ly^don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Călydon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kaludw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n6355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient town in Ætolia</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Kurt-aga</hi>), <hi rend="ital">on</hi> <pb n="274" /> <cb n="CAMB" /> <hi rend="ital">the river Evenus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">built by a hero of the same name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 495</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the residence of Œneus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Meleager and Deianira</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and grandfather of Diomedes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 2, 3, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 415</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 270</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 270</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:49" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 49</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">ace.</hi> Calydonem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 72</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Gr. Calydona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 306</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 147</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6355.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n6355.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Călydōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Calydonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Calydonian boar</tr>, <tr>sent by the enraged Diana</tr>, <tr>and killed by Meleager</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Meleager</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Acheloüs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:727" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 727</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 2: Tydidae hasta,</quote> <trans><tr>of Diomedes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:769" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 769</bibl></cit>: regna, <hi rend="ital">the kingdom of Diomedes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Lower Italy</hi> (Daunia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:512" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 512</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Călydōnĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Calydonian women</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 583" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 583</bibl>. —*</sense><sense id="n6355.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Călydōnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Calydonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 180</bibl></cit> (al. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căly-dōnēa</orth>).—</sense><sense id="n6355.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Călydōnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Calydonian woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calydonides matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 527</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:736" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 736</bibl>.—And <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign> = <hi rend="ital">Deianira</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calymma: <entryFree id="n6356" type="main" key="ca^lymma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călymma</orth>, v. calumma.</entryFree>
calymne: <entryFree id="n6357" type="main" key="Ca^lymne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Călymnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/lumna</foreign>, <sense id="n6357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not far from Rhodes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished for its honey</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kalimno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 222</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 81</bibl>.—Called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Că-lymnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
calypso: <entryFree id="n6358" type="main" key="Ca^lypso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Călypso</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:77" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 171</bibl>: <sense id="n6358.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Calypsonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 2, 10</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> regularly Calypso, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 63</bibl>; Plin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 102</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 685</bibl> ib.; Rudd. I. p. 60, n. 84; but Calypsonem, Liv. And. ap. Prisc. l. l., and Calypsonem, Pac. ib., and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 47</bibl> P.; Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 2, 10</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kaluyw/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Atlas</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">Oceanus</hi>), <hi rend="ital">who ruled in the Island Ogygia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 96</bibl> (acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 18</bibl>, erroneously, in Aeaea), <hi rend="ital">in the Sicilian Sea</hi>, she received Ulysses as a guest, bore by him Auson (v. Auso-nes), and, with the greatest unwillingness, allowed him to continue his voyage, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:77" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO">2</bibl> (3), 21, 13.</sense></entryFree>
calyx: <entryFree id="n6359" type="greek" key="ca^lyx1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călyx</orth>, <itype>ycis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/luc [kalu/ptw</foreign>; hence, any covering, husk, hull, shell], <sense id="n6359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the bud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cup</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">calyx of a flower.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6359.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">narcissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 5, 12, § 25</bibl></cit>. rosae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:121" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 18, 73, § 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">papaveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 18, 76, § 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6359.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6359.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The shell of fruits</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:86" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 22, 24, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:86" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 4, 43, § 86</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6359.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An egg-shell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6359.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The covering of shell-fish</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">the shell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:100:9:56:82:section=174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 100, 9, 56, 82, § 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:39" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 4, 14, § 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6359.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A covering of wax around fruit</hi> to preserve it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 17, 18, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6360" type="greek" key="ca^lyx2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">călyx</orth>, <itype>ycis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/luc</foreign>, <sense id="n6360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant of two kinds</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the monk</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-hood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:58 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 36, § 58 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cama: <entryFree id="n6361" type="gloss" key="cama"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cama</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">xamai/</foreign> = humi</etym>, <sense id="n6361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bed near the ground</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 11, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
camacum: <entryFree id="n6362" type="main" key="ca^ma^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămăcum</orth>, v. comacum.</entryFree>
camaldunum: <entryFree id="n6363" type="main" key="Camaldu_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Camaldūnum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Camalod-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. Camuldunum.</entryFree>
camara: <entryFree id="n6364" type="main" key="camara"><orth extent="full" lang="la">camara</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v camera.</entryFree>
camarina: <entryFree id="n6365" type="main" key="Ca^ma^ri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămărīna</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămĕrī-na</orth>; cf. camera), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<case>acc.</case> Gr. Camarinan, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F 4, 477</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*kama/ri=na</foreign>, <sense id="n6365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city on the south-west coast of Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony from Syracuse</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Camarana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 701</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
camaro: <entryFree id="n6366" type="main" key="ca^ma^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămăro</orth>, v. camero.</entryFree>
camarus: <entryFree id="n6367" type="main" key="camarus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">camarus</orth>, <itype>i, for cammarus</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
cambio: <entryFree id="n6368" type="main" key="cambio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cambio</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (<sense id="n6368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> campsi, acc. to Charis. pp. 219 and 233 P., and <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 906</bibl> ib.) [whence the Ital. and mercantile cambio, cambiare, cambiatura, etc.; Fr. change, changer, etc.; Engl. change, etc.], <hi rend="ital">to exchange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barter</hi>: muto, <foreign lang="greek">a)mei/bomai</foreign>, Charis. l.l. (post-class. and very rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 284</bibl>; Sicul. Flacc. Cond. Agr. p. 13 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
cambitas: <entryFree id="n6369" type="gloss" key="cambi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cambĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exchange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barter</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">a\ntikatallagh/</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
cambunii: <entryFree id="n6370" type="main" key="Cambu_nii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cambūnii</orth> <itype>Montes</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain range on the boundary between Thessaly and Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 53, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cambyses: <entryFree id="n6371" type="main" key="Camby_ses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cambȳses</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kambu/shs</foreign>. <sense id="n6371.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The husband of Mandane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of the elder Cyrus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6371.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The son and successor of the elder Cyrus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9</bibl>; Mel. <cb n="CAME" /> 1, 11, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3</bibl>, ext. 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 280</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n6371.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Albania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which rises on the Caucasus and empties into the Cyrus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Jora</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6371.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A river of Media</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
camela: <entryFree id="n6372" type="main" key="ca^me_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>camelus</etym>, <sense id="n6372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female camel</hi>, Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 14, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
camelae: <entryFree id="n6373" type="gloss" key="ca^me_lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămēlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">gamh/lios</foreign>, pertaining to <foreign lang="greek">ga/mos</foreign> = a marriage</etym>, <sense id="n6373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a marriage festival</hi>: virgines, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=63" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 63</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
camelarius: <entryFree id="n6374" type="main" key="ca^me_la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămēlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>camelus</etym>, <sense id="n6374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cameldriver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 18, § 11</bibl>; Edict. Diocl. p. 19.</sense></entryFree>
camelelasia: <entryFree id="n6375" type="greek" key="ca^me_le_la^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămēlēlăsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kamhlhlasi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n6375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">camel-driving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the care of the camels belonging to the State</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 18, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
camelinus: <entryFree id="n6376" type="main" key="ca^me_li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămēlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>camelus</etym>, <sense id="n6376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to a camel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">camel's-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 33, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 49, 109, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 200</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
camella: <entryFree id="n6377" type="main" key="ca^mella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n6377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f dim.</hi> [camera], <hi rend="ital">a kind of drinking vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wine-goblet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wine-cup</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cup</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:779" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 779</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 135, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">137, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">64, 13</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Pollux,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
camelopardalis: <entryFree id="n6378" type="greek" key="ca^me_lo^parda^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămēlŏpardălis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cămēlŏ-pardălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. III. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 14, 5</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cămēlŏ-pardus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 2, 19</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">kamhlopa/rdalis</foreign>, <sense id="n6378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a camelopard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">giraffe</hi>: Cervus camelopardalis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=100" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 100</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 18, 27, § 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 30, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
camelopodion: <entryFree id="n6379" type="greek" key="ca^me_lo^po^di^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămēlŏpŏdĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kamhlopo/dion</foreign>, <sense id="n6379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">camel</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-foot</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">horehound</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
camelus: <entryFree id="n6380" type="foreign" key="ca^me_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămēlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n6380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 18, 26, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:164" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 62, § 164</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 194, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:32:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 32, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 29, 2</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">ka/mhlos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a camel</hi>, with either one or two humps, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 62, § 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=100" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 100</bibl> Müll., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 40, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 12</bibl>; cf. camela.</sense></entryFree>
camena: <entryFree id="n6381" type="main" key="Ca^me_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămēna</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămoena</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Casmēna</orth>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 27</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex Fest. s. v. dusmoso, p. 67 ib., and pesnis, p. 205 ib.) [root kas-, sing, whence carmen], pure Lat. (perh. Ital.) name of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*mou=sa</foreign>, <sense id="n6381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Muse</hi> (freq. in Hor., not in Lucr.), Liv. And. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:9:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acceptus novem Camenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:62" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amant alterna Camenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 59</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 19</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 45</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 5</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> A. P 275</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 10, 1; Ov M. 14, 434; 15, 482; Plin. H.N praef. § 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:21 al" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 21 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl>.—Numa devoted a grove to the Muses in the vicinity of Rome before the Porta Capena, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Vitr 8, 3, 1.—They had also, probably in the same place, a temple,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 5, 10, § 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6381.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">poetry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a poem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">song</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā dicende Camenā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 12, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P 4, 13, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:24" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:191" default="NO">4, 1, 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:7:3" default="NO">4, 7, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6381.2" n="II" level="1"> Deriv: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămēnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to the Muses</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Hippocrene,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Phaen. Arat. 495</bibl></cit>. modi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:53" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
camera: <entryFree id="n6382" type="greek" key="ca^me^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămĕra</orth> (in MSS. and editt. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">că-măra</orth>; cf. Charis. p 43 P.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kama/ra</foreign> [cf. <foreign lang="greek">ka/mptw</foreign> = to bend, curve; Ital. camera; Germ. Kammer; Fr. chambre; <sense id="n6382.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Engl. chamber],</quote> <trans><tr>a vault</tr>, <tr>an arched roof</tr>, <tr>an arch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:8:1" default="NO">3, 8, 1</bibl>; Lucr. Fragm. ap. Charis. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 2, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:7:3" default="NO">3, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:17:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 17, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:60" default="NO">11, 3, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">camera vitrea,</quote> <trans><tr>covered with glass</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 64, § 189</bibl></cit>.—In ships, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">upon the manner of building them,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>: camerae caelum, <hi rend="ital">the interior of a vault</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6382.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a flat ship with an arched covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used by those dwelling on the Black Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
camerarius: <entryFree id="n6383" type="main" key="ca^me^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămĕrārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cămă-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>camera</etym>: cucurbitae, <sense id="n6383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">which climb over something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">climbing</hi> (opp. plebeiae, that creep upon the ground), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 24, § 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cameratio: <entryFree id="n6384" type="hapax" key="ca^me^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>camero</etym>, prop. an arching; <sense id="n6384.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">hence, abstr. pro concr.,</quote> <trans><tr>a vault</tr>, <tr>arch</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Carac. 9, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cameria: <entryFree id="n6385" type="main" key="Ca^me^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kameri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n6385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 38, 4</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 68</bibl>, <cb n="CAMI" /> and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 24</bibl>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămĕrĭum</orth>).—</sense><sense id="n6385.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Camerinus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">municipium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6385.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămĕrīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cameria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 5</bibl>, n. 1. —</sense><sense id="n6385.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a cognomen in the very distinguished</hi> gens Sulpicia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 31, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 2 al.</bibl>—Hence, for <hi rend="ital">people of rank</hi> in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:90" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:38" default="NO">8, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
camerinum: <entryFree id="n6386" type="main" key="Ca^me^ri_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămĕrīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n6386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Picenum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Camerino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, B, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
