C. 1, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6386.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n6386.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămers</orth>, <itype>ertis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Camerinum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 19, 53</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămertes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype> (Camertum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:157" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 157</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Camerinum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 113</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">friends of the Romans, both in opp. to the Etruscans, and later against Hannibal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 20, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 36, 7</bibl> and 8; 28, 45, 20.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulvum Camertem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudande Camers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:463" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 463</bibl></cit>.—*</sense><sense id="n6386.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămertīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Camerinum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 20, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
camerium: <entryFree id="n6387" type="main" key="Ca^me^rium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămĕrium</orth>, v. Cameria.</entryFree>
camero: <entryFree id="n6388" type="main" key="ca^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cămă-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>camera</etym>, <sense id="n6388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to vault</hi> or <hi rend="ital">arch over</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 30, 50, § 97</bibl>. —<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cameratum elogium,</quote> <trans><tr>constructed with art</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cameses: <entryFree id="n6389" type="main" key="Ca^me^ses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămĕses</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mythic king in Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Janus</hi>, Hyg. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
camilla: <entryFree id="n6390" type="main" key="camilla1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">camilla</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">casmilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 1. camillus, II.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6391" type="main" key="Camilla2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Camilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Volscian heroine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who perished in the war between Æneas and Turnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:803" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 803</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 535</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
camillum: <entryFree id="n6392" type="gloss" key="camillum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">camillum</orth>, v. cumera.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6393" type="main" key="camillum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">camillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, in architecture = loculamentum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 15</bibl> dub. (Rode supposes scamillum, a little bench; Bald. Lex. Vitr. batillum).</entryFree>
camillus: <entryFree id="n6394" type="main" key="ca^millus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămillus</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">casmilus</orth>; cf. Camena and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 34</bibl> Müll.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>with difficulty connected with the Samothracian Kabiren-Hermes, <foreign lang="greek">*ka/dmilos</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*ka/dmos</foreign>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:3:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 3, § 34</bibl> Müll., and <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 8</bibl>; perh. <lbl>dim.</lbl> from root of Camena; cf. carmen</etym>, <sense id="n6394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a noble youth employed in the sacrifices of the</hi> Flamen Dialis, and then, gen., <hi rend="ital">in religious offices</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=43" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 43</bibl> Müll.: hiberno pulvere, verno luto, grandia farra Camille metes, Poët. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=93" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 93</bibl>. —The same verse is given with the expl., Camillus adulescens est, by <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani pueros et puellas nobiles et investes Camillos et Camillas appellant, flaminicarum et flaminum praeministros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 8, 7</bibl></cit>; repeated by <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 11, 543</bibl>; cf. also Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=63" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 63</bibl> Müll. s. v. cumeram.—</sense><sense id="n6394.1" n="B" level="2"> = pusillus, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6394.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">camilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a maiden of unblemished birth and character</hi>: caelitum camilla, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 34</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. v. 232 Rib.): = administra, <hi rend="ital">since only such maidens were permitted to serve in the sacred rites</hi>, v. Varr. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 11, 543</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6395" type="main" key="Ca^millus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cognomen of several persons in the</hi> gens Furia; <cit><quote lang="la">the most distinguished of whom was M. Furius Camillus,</quote> <trans><tr>who conquered Veii</tr>, <tr>and freed Rome from the Gauls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:19:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 19, 2 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
camino: <entryFree id="n6396" type="main" key="ca^mi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămīno</orth>, no <sense id="n6396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>caminus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make like an oven</hi> or <hi rend="ital">furnace</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the foll. pass.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caminata fossura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caminus: <entryFree id="n6397" type="greek" key="ca^mi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cămīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">h( ka/minos</foreign> [Germ. Kamin; Fr. chemine/e; Engl. chimney], <sense id="n6397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a furnace.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6397.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A smelting-furnace for the working of metals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a forge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:10" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:35" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 6, 16, § 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescunt (patrimonia) incude assiduā semperque ardente camino, i. e.,</quote> <trans><tr>by incessant labor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:118" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6397.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the forge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">smithy of Vulcan and the Cyclopes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under Ætna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 580</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 630</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 418</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:473" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 473</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 106, 110, § 237</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6397.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A furnace for heating an apartment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 8</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6397.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> = ignis, <hi rend="ital">fire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">camino luculento uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 766" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 766</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6397.5" n="C" level="2"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum addere camino,</quote> <trans><tr>to pour oil upon the fire</tr>, <tr>to aggravate an evil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 321</bibl></cit>. <pb n="275" /> <cb n="CAMP" /></sense></entryFree>
camirus: <entryFree id="n6398" type="main" key="Ca^mi_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămīrus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kameiros</foreign>. <sense id="n6398.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of the fourth Hercules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Jalysus and Lindus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and founder of the town named after him in Rhodes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 36, § 132</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6398.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town on the west side of the island of Rhodes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 54</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Camīrenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Camirus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
camisia: <entryFree id="n6399" type="gloss" key="cami^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">camĭsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gallic; whence Ital. camicia, Fr. chemise</etym>, <sense id="n6399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a linen shirt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">night-gown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">camisias vocari, quod in his dormimus in camis id est stratis nostris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 22, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. Vest. Mul. 64</bibl>, n. 11; Paul. ex Fest. s. v. supparus, p. 310 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
cammaron: <entryFree id="n6400" type="greek" key="camma^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cammăron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/mmaron</foreign>, <sense id="n6400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> aconitum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 3, 2, § 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cammarus: <entryFree id="n6401" type="greek" key="camma^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cammărus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">camărus, gammă-rus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/mmaros</foreign>, <sense id="n6401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-crab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lobster</hi> (so called from its vaulted back), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:11:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:4" default="NO">8, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 3, 2, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:96" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 8, 44, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:43" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:84 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 84 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
camoena: <entryFree id="n6402" type="main" key="Ca^moena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămoena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Camena.</entryFree>
campa: <entryFree id="n6403" type="main" key="campa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">campa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. campe.</entryFree>
campagus: <entryFree id="n6404" type="main" key="campa^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">campăgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of boot worn by military officers</hi> (late Lat.), Treb Gall. 16; Capitol. Max. jun. c. 2; Edict. Diocl. p. 24.</sense></entryFree>
campana: <entryFree id="n6405" type="main" key="campana1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">campana</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Ital. campana, a bell; campanile, a belfry</etym>, <sense id="n6405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bell</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n6406" type="main" key="Campa_na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Campāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Campania, II. A. 1.</entryFree>
campaneus: <entryFree id="n6407" type="main" key="campa_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">campānĕus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">campānĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>campus</etym>; in the land surveyors = campestris, <sense id="n6407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the fields</hi>: loca, Innocent. ap. Goes. pp. 239 and 240.</sense></entryFree>
campania: <entryFree id="n6408" type="main" key="Campa_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Campānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kampani/a</foreign> [campus, i. e. the plain, the level country], <sense id="n6408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the very fruitful and luxurious</hi> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl>) <hi rend="ital">province of Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Middle Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose chief city was Capua</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Terra di Lavoro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl> and 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 52, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6408.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n6408.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Campanian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Campania</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 32, 87</bibl>; Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 20, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:61:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 61, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:19:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lyaeus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:13:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 13, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:61" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 20, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>earthen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trulla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 45, 2</bibl></cit>: morbus, <hi rend="ital">a kind of wart</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tumor endemic in Campania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 62</bibl> (v. Schol. Crucq.): Campanus pons, <hi rend="ital">near Capua</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leading over the</hi> Savo <hi rend="ital">to</hi> Sinuessa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Capua</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 145</bibl></cit>: Via, <hi rend="ital">a branch of the</hi> Via Appia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 374, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">611, 13 al.</bibl>—<pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n6408.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">campāna</orth>, ae <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stilyard</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 25, 6</bibl>; Gloss. Vat. ap. Auct. Class. 7, p. 581 Mai.—</sense><sense id="n6408.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Campanians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 35, 94</bibl> and 96 al.—</sense><sense id="n6408.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campā-nĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Campanian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiscinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> and 153: <cit><quote lang="la">serta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 107, 1</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 29, § 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sertula Campana): peristromata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>. —*</sense><sense id="n6408.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campānĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Campanian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra = Campania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 33</bibl></cit> (cf.: terra Arabia, Celtiberia, etc.).—* </sense><sense id="n6408.7" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Compania</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 144</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc. (also ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 486, 24</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
campe: <entryFree id="n6409" type="greek" key="campe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">campē</orth> (Col. poët. 10, 324; 10, 366), ēs (the Lat. form of the <case>nom.</case> campa is not used), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/mph</foreign>. *<sense id="n6409.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A turning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">writhing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campas dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>to seek evasions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6409.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A caterpillar</hi>, pure Lat. eruca, Col. l. l. (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 63</bibl>, <foreign lang="greek">ka/mpai</foreign>); <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 6</bibl> and 13.</sense></entryFree>
campensis: <entryFree id="n6410" type="main" key="Campensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Campensis</orth> <etym>campus</etym>, <sense id="n6410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Isis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who had a temple on the Campus Martius</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 270, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
campester: <entryFree id="n6411" type="main" key="campester"><orth extent="full" lang="la">campester</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">campestris</orth>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 696</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:3" default="NO">7, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:14:1" default="NO">3, 14, 1</bibl>, is suspicious; v. Schneid. ad h. l.), <itype>tris, tre</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n6411.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a level field</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">level</hi>, <hi rend="ital">champaign</hi>, opp. montanus and collinus; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:38" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 38</bibl>, <cb n="CAMP" /> 2; <cit><quote lang="la">40, 53, 3 al.: tria genera simplicia agrorum campestre, collinum et montanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campester locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 6; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vineae collinae et campestres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:21:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 6, 22, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:67 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 15, 26, § 67 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>. situs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">positio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 18, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campestres ac demissi loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 32, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:58:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 58, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:45:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 45, 10</bibl></cit>. oppidum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:39:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 39, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbari,</quote> <trans><tr>dwelling in plains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 53, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Scythae, Hor C. 3, 24, 9: hostis,</quote> <trans><tr>fighting on a plain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:18:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 18, 3 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n6411.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">campe-strĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flat land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">level ground</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in campestribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6411.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Relating to the Campus Martius.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6411.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of the athletic exercises held there</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <trans><tr>contests in the Campus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decursio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <trans><tr>used in the contests held there</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> A. P 379</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n6411.4" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n6411.5" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">campestre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. velamentum), <hi rend="ital">a leather apron worn about the loins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wrestling-apron</hi> (orig. of the combatants in the Field of Mars; hence the name): campestria Latinum verbum est, sed ex eo dictum, quod juvenes, qui exercebantur in Campo, pudenda operiebant; <cit><quote lang="la">unde qui ita succincti sunt campestratos vulgus appellat, Aug. Civ Dei, 14, 17.—Also worn in hot weather under the toga, in place of the tunic,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 18</bibl></cit>; Vulcat. Av<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cass. 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6411.6" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">campe-stres</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the deities who presided over contests</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1358</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1794</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Don.</author> 59, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6411.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pertaining to the comitia held in the Campus Martius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 20, 42</bibl></cit>: gratia. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ex campestri certamine in senatum pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>, n 14.</sense></entryFree>
campestratus: <entryFree id="n6412" type="gloss" key="campestra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">campestrātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed with the campestre</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apron</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 14, 17; v. campester, II. A. 2. a.</sense></entryFree>
campicursio: <entryFree id="n6413" type="hapax" key="campi^cursi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">campĭ-cursĭo</orth> (better as two words), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>campus</etym>, <sense id="n6413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">military exercise in the</hi> Campus Martius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 4</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 7</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 6</bibl>, called decursio).</sense></entryFree>
campidoctor: <entryFree id="n6414" type="main" key="campi^doctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">campĭ-doctor</orth> (better as two words), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who drills</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exercises soldiers in the</hi> Campus Martius, <hi rend="ital">a drill-master</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1790</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3495</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
campigeni: <entryFree id="n6415" type="main" key="campi^ge^ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">campĭgĕni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>campus-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n6415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">well disciplined soldiers</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
campsanema: <entryFree id="n6416" type="main" key="campsane_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">campsanēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n6416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, = ros marinus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
campso: <entryFree id="n6417" type="hapax" key="campso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">campso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ka/mptw</foreign>, to bend, to turn</etym>, <sense id="n6417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn around a place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sail by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to double</hi>: Leucatam, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 906</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 334 Vahl.; cf. campter and flecto).</sense></entryFree>
camptaules: <entryFree id="n6418" type="hapax" key="camptaules"><orth extent="full" lang="la">camptaules</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown kind of musician</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
campter: <entryFree id="n6419" type="greek" key="campter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">campter</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kampth/r</foreign>, <sense id="n6419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an angle</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 65, 1</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 48 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
campus: <entryFree id="n6420" type="main" key="campus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">campus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">kh=pos</foreign>, Dor. <foreign lang="greek">ka=pos</foreign>; perh. for scampus from <foreign lang="greek">ska/ptw</foreign>, to dig, scabo; whence Campania, and perh. Capua; for the inserted <hi rend="ital">m</hi>, cf. AAB-' <foreign lang="greek">lamba/nw</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n6420.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n6420.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of any open, level land, without reference to cultivation or use, <hi rend="ital">an even</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flat place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">field</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: ager, planities, aequor; opp. mons, collis, silva, etc.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Doed. Syn. III. p. 8 sq.): saxum plani raptim petit aequora campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1015" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1015</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:950" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 950</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in camporum patentium aequoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 42, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 781</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:376" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 376</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequo dare se campo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aequo campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campos pedibus transire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 460</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 493</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">campos et montes peragrantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 42, 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia frugifera atque immensa camporum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 64, 161</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1372</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus in prata et arva salictaque et arundineta digestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 18, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:782" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 782</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:3:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequens herbis et fertilis ubere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramineus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 287</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingues Asiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: redeunt jam gramina <cb n="CAMP" /> campis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbosus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbidus aquosusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opimus, id'. 31, 41, 7: campi frumenti ac pecoris et omnium copiā rerum opulenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:17 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 17 al.</bibl></cit>— <cit><quote lang="la">Campus, like ager, is used in a wider or more restricted sense, as conveying a particular or more general idea: in agro publico campi duo milia jugerum immunia possidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros Vaticanum et Pupinium, cum suis opimis atque uberibus campis conferendos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si pinguis agros metabere campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 274</bibl></cit> and 276; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:324 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 324 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamina magna per campos instructa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus terrenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimicaturum puro ac patenti campo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(praefecti regii) suas copias in campum Marathona deduxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: numquam in campo (<hi rend="ital">in the free</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open field</hi>) sui fecit potestatem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 3, 6</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 151</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:579" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 579</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insistere Bedriacensibus campis ac vestigia recentis victoriae lustrare oculis concupivit (Vitellius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 70</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Bebriaci Campo spolium affectare,</quote> <trans><tr>the battlefield</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:106" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campum colligere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6420.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the produce of the field</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moriturque ad sibila (serpentis) campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:528" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 528</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6420.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> like aequor, in gen., <hi rend="ital">any level surface</hi> (of the sea, a rock, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">caeruleos per campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi natantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 489</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:405" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 405</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1141" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 724</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 214</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus Liberioris aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:315" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 315</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 356: immotā attollitur undā Campus (i. e. saxum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6420.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">feratur eloquentia non semitis sed campis,</quote> <trans><tr>on the open field</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oratio) aequo congressa campo,</quote> <trans><tr>on a fair field</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut campum nacti expositionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6420.5" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n6420.6" n="A" level="2"> As geog. designation. </sense><sense id="n6420.7" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campi Alēii</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a plain in Lycia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6420.8" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campi Lăpĭdĕi</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a stony plain near Marseilles</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">La Crau</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 10, 31, § 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6420.9" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campi Ma-cri</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a district in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">on the river Macra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl>, prooem. § 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 12, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6420.10" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campi Magni</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in Africa</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:42:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 42, 167</bibl> (cf. Vahl. p. 167); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 8, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6420.11" n="5" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campi Vĕtĕres</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in Lucania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 16, 25</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6420.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An open place in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near Rome.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6420.13" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campus Esquĭlīnus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">on the Esquiline Hill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6420.14" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campus Flāmĭnĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">on which stood the Circus Flaminius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 32</bibl> Müll. —</sense><sense id="n6420.15" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campus Scĕlĕrātus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">near the Colline Gate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 15, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=333" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 333</bibl> Müll. —</sense><sense id="n6420.16" n="4" level="3"> Far more freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a grassy plain in Rome along the Tiber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the ninth district</hi>, orig. belonging to the Tarquinii, after whose expulsion it was consecrated to Mars (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl>); hence fully called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campus Martĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a place of assembly for the Roman people at the</hi> comitia centuriata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:47 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 47 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6420.17" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the comitia themselves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curiam pro senatu, campum pro comitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:42:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 42, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fors domina campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 180</bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">much resorted to by the Romans for games</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and recreation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a place for military drills</hi>, etc. (cf. campicursio and campidoctor), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 18, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:62:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 62, 253</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 71, 287</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 126</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 162</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6420.18" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a place of action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a field</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a theatre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportunity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject for debate</hi>, etc. (cf. area) (a favorite figure of Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">me ex hoc ut ita dicam campo aequitatis ad istas verborum angustias revocas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:29:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 29, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sit campus, in quo exsultare possit oratio, cur eam tantas in angustias et in Stoicorum dumeta compellimus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 35, 112</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc tanto tamque immenso campo cum liceat oratori vagari libere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 31, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus est in re publicā campus, multis apertus cursus ad laudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum vobis sors campum dedit, in quo excurrere virtus cognoscique posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:31:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 31, 1</bibl>: honoris et gloriae campus, id. <pb n="276" /> <cb n="CANA" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:70:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 70, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetorum campus de Marathone, Salamine, Plataeis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6421" type="greek" key="campus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">campus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/mpos</foreign>, <sense id="n6421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seaanimal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marini = hippocampi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:43:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 43, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
camulodunum: <entryFree id="n6422" type="main" key="Camulo^du_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Camulŏdūnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n6422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Trinobantes in Britain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the first Roman colony under Claudius</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Colchester</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 31</bibl>; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Camalŏdū-num</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 208</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Camolŏdūnum</orth>, Itin. Anton. p. 230 Parth.; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Camal-dūnum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 75, 77, § 185</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
camulus: <entryFree id="n6423" type="gloss" key="Ca^mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cămŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Mars</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 56, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">40, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
camum: <entryFree id="n6424" type="main" key="camum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">camum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n6424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of beer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12</bibl>; Edict. Diocl. p. 28.</sense></entryFree>
camur: <entryFree id="n6425" type="main" key="camur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">camur</orth>, <itype>ra, rum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, peregrinum verbum; prob. root of <foreign lang="greek">ka/mptw</foreign>; cf.: camera, <foreign lang="greek">kama/ra</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 30, 8</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=43" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 43</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 3, 55</bibl>; <case>nom.</case> camur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 8, 5</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n6425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crooked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turned inwards</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">camuris hirtae sub cornibus aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 55</bibl></cit> (camuris, i. e. curvis; unde et camerae appellantur, Serv.: camuri boves sunt, qui conversa introrsus cornua habent, Philarg.): arcus, <hi rend="ital">an arch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vault</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 12, 53; cf. Jan. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
camus:
<entryFree id="n6426" type="greek" key="ca_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cāmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">khmo/s</foreign> (Dor. <foreign lang="greek">kamo/s</foreign>). <sense id="n6426.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A muzzle</hi> for horses (only in eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 31, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Hex. 6, 3</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n6426.1" n="II" level="1"> Perh. <hi rend="ital">a kind of collar for the neck</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 200, 16</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 302 Rib.).</sense>
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">cana</orth>, Gr. (*<foreign lang="greek">ka/neon</foreign>, <number>plur.</number> <foreign lang="greek">ka/nea ka/nh</foreign>, a wicker basket) for canistra, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=45" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 45</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
canaba: <entryFree id="n6427" type="main" key="ca_na^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cānăba</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cannăba</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">ka/nabos</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">ka/nna</foreign>; acc. to others, with <foreign lang="greek">kalu/bh</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n6427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hovel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 61" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 61</bibl>, de Temp.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4077</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canabula: <entryFree id="n6428" type="main" key="ca_na^bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cānăbŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>canaba</etym>, <sense id="n6428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small hovel</hi>, Auct. Limit. p. 257 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
canace: <entryFree id="n6429" type="main" key="Ca^na^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănăcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kana/kh</foreign>. <sense id="n6429.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Æolus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">living in incest with her brother Macareus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bore a son to him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was forced by her father to kill herself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:384" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 384</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6429.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a dog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canacheni: <entryFree id="n6430" type="hapax" key="ca^na^che_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănăchēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a class of thieves</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 207</bibl> dub.; cf. Öhler ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
canachus: <entryFree id="n6431" type="main" key="Ca^na^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/naxos</foreign>, <sense id="n6431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two artists of Sicyon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canae: <entryFree id="n6432" type="main" key="Canae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Canae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/nai</foreign>, <sense id="n6432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the coast of Æolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite Mytilene</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kanot-Koli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 45, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canalicius: <entryFree id="n6433" type="main" key="ca^na_li^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănālĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. canaliensis.</entryFree>
canalicolae: <entryFree id="n6434" type="gloss" key="Ca^na_li^co^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănālĭcŏlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">poor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lazy people who used to lounge near the Forum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at a place called the Canalis</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=45" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 45</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
canaliculatus: <entryFree id="n6435" type="main" key="ca^na_li^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănālĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>canaliculus</etym>, <sense id="n6435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a channel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">channelled</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 7, 36, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:78" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 9, 55, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canaliculus: <entryFree id="n6436" type="main" key="ca^na_li^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănālĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cănālĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 14</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 198, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 11, 2</bibl>; cf. canalis), <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>canalis</etym>, <sense id="n6436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small channel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pipe</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">gutter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6436.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A water-channel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6436.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A channel of a triglyph</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6436.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The channel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">groove of a catapult</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6436.4" n="IV" level="1"> In surgery, <hi rend="ital">a splint for broken bones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
canaliensis: <entryFree id="n6437" type="main" key="ca^na_li^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănālĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cănālĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dug out of shafts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pits</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum, quod puteis foditur canalicium vocant, alii canaliense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 68</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (sc. aurum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4, 23, § 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canalis: <entryFree id="n6438" type="main" key="ca^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (rarely ante- and postclass., <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:7:8" default="NO">3, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:11:2" default="NO">3, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 127</bibl> and 149; cf. the <lbl>dim.</lbl> canaliculus, etc., Rudd. I. p. 25, n. 35) [kindr. with Sanscr. root khan, fodere, perfodere; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xai/nw, xanw=</foreign>; Germ. gähnen, to yawn; or cf. canna, a pipe, reed; Fr. canale; Engl. canal; Sp. cañon]. <sense id="n6438.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a pipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">groove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">channel</hi>, whether open or closed, esp. <hi rend="ital">a water-pipe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">channel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a conduit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a canal</hi>, Cato, R. R. l. l.; Varr. R. R. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 330</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 265</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 31, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:205" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 205</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 127 al.</bibl>—Of <hi rend="ital">a channel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trench in mines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 69</bibl>.—Of <cb n="CANC" /> <hi rend="ital">the windpipe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 10, 10, § 29</bibl></cit>. —Of <hi rend="ital">the</hi> cervix vulvae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1, § 38</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a sewer running to the</hi> cloaca: <cit><quote lang="la">(fore) in medio propter canalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. canalicolae.—</sense><sense id="n6438.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (not in Cic.), of vision: <cit><quote lang="la">(pupillae) angustiae non sinunt vagari incertam aciem ac velut canali dirigunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 148</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus limine transmeato... jam canale directo perges ad regiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 180, 19</bibl></cit>.—And of <hi rend="ital">the flow of speech</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleniore canali fluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:167" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 167</bibl></cit>: certo canali cuncta decurrere, Gallicanus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 198, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6438.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n6438.3" n="A" level="2"> In architecture, <hi rend="ital">the groove</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fluting upon Ionic capitals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 5, 7</bibl>.— —</sense><sense id="n6438.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The channel for missiles in a catapult</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6438.5" n="C" level="2"> In surgery, <hi rend="ital">a splint for holding broken bones together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:section=65 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10, § 65 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6438.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A household utensil of unknown form and use</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 21</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6438.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A musical instrument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the reed-pipe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:76" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canarius: <entryFree id="n6439" type="main" key="ca^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>canis</etym>, <sense id="n6439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to dogs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dog-</hi>: augurium, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in which dogs were offered</hi>, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 14</bibl>; Fest. s. v. rutilae, p. 285 Müll. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:936" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 936</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:342 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 342 sq.</bibl>; Paul. ex Fest. s. v. catularia, p. 45 Müll.): herba, <hi rend="ital">a kind of grass;</hi> acc. to Sprengel, <hi rend="ital">fingerformed panic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Panicum dactylon, Linn.: lappa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 116, § 176</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6439.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6439.2" n="A" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">adj. prop.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănārĭa insula</orth>, <hi rend="ital">one of the</hi> Insulae Fortunatae <hi rend="ital">in the Atlantic Ocean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so called from its large dogs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 32, 37, § 205</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 56, 17</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Canariae insulae,</quote> <trans><tr>the Canary islands</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6439.3" n="B" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">nom. prop.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cănārii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a voracious people of Mauritania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
canaster: <entryFree id="n6440" type="gloss" key="ca_naster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cānaster</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">micopo/lios</foreign>, <sense id="n6440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-gray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grizzled</hi>, Gloss. Gr. Lat. [canus].</sense></entryFree>
canatim: <entryFree id="n6441" type="gloss" key="ca^na_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cănātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>canis</etym>, <sense id="n6441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the manner of a dog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like a dog</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kunhdo/n</foreign>, Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 40, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cancamum: <entryFree id="n6442" type="greek" key="canca^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancămum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/gkamon</foreign>, <sense id="n6442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Arabian gum used for incense</hi>: Amyris Kataf, Forsk.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 20, 44, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cancellarius: <entryFree id="n6443" type="main" key="cancella_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancellārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cancelli; Engl. chancellor</etym> (late Lat.). <sense id="n6443.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of porter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">door-keeper</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6443.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A secretary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6444" type="main" key="cancella_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancellārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cancelli</etym>, <sense id="n6444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">living</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kept behind bars</hi>: turdus, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:24" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cancellatim: <entryFree id="n6445" type="main" key="cancella_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancellātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>cancellatus, cancello</etym>, <sense id="n6445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lattice-formed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trellis-like</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Plin. the elder),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 19, § 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 33, 52, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:201" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 79, § 201</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cancellatio: <entryFree id="n6446" type="main" key="cancella_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancellātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cancello</etym>, in the agrimensores, <sense id="n6446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fixing of boundaries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the measuring of land</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Col. p. 109" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Col. p. 109</bibl> Goes.; Sicul. Flacc. p. 16.</sense></entryFree>
cancelli: <entryFree id="n6447" type="main" key="cancelli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancelli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (<number>sing.</number> cancellus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:24:9:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 24, 9, § 1</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. cancer</etym>, <sense id="n6447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lattice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclosure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">balustrade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">railings</hi>: ( = <foreign lang="greek">kigkli/des</foreign>; Latini tamen cancellos non tantum fores <foreign lang="greek">tou= dikasthri/ou</foreign>, sed etiam omne consaeptum appellant, Salmas. Hist. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:page=483" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> p. 483</bibl>) scenici et theatri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aenei rivorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 6</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">the bar in a court of justice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 3, 59, § 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus ex fori cancellis plausus excitatus,</quote> <trans><tr>the barrier in public spectacles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:58:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 58, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:41:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 41, § 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=26" default="NO">33, 7, 12, § 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenestrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 11:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepta cancellorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">reticulated skin</hi> of the elephant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 10, 10, § 30</bibl>; cf. cancello.—</sense><sense id="n6447.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">boundaries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limits</hi> (so perh. only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">si extra hos cancellos egredi conabor, quos mihi ipse circumdedi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse certam rerum forensibus cancellis circumscriptam scientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:12:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 12, 52</bibl></cit>: severitatis, Cod. Th. 1, 12, 8.—</sense><sense id="n6447.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the space enclosed by boundaries</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cancello: <entryFree id="n6448" type="main" key="cancello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancello</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cancelli</etym> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n6448.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to make like a lattice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lattice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum, i. e. with vines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cancellata cutis (elephanti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 10, 10, § 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cancelli: cancellato bracchiorum implexu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 51, 74, § 164</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6448.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in the Lat. of the jurists, <hi rend="ital">to strike out a writing lattice-wise</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*x</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">to strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cross out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cancel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:4:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chirographum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:24" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 22, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae cautionesque cancellatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:84" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 47, 2, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:47:section=2" default="NO">2, 14, 47, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:15:section=1" default="NO">29, 1, 15, § 1</bibl>; Cod. 6, 33, 3. <cb n="CAND" /></sense></entryFree>
cancellosus: <entryFree id="n6449" type="main" key="cancello_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancellōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cancelli</etym>, <sense id="n6449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covered with bars</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a railing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cancellus: <entryFree id="n6450" type="main" key="cancellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cancellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. cancelli.</entryFree>
